Text: [First scene opens with three Rangers riding through a tunnel, leaving the Wall, and going into the woods. (Eerie music in background) One Ranger splits off and finds a campsite full of mutilated bodies, including a child hanging from a tree branch. A birds-eye view shows the bodies arranged in a shield-like pattern. The Ranger rides back to the other two.]
What d'you expect? They're savages. One lot steals a goat from another lot and before you know it, they're ripping each other to pieces.
Speaker: WAYMAR ROYCE

Text: I've never seen wildlings do a thing like this. I've never seen a thing like this, not ever in my life.
Speaker: WILL

Text: How close did you get?
Speaker: WAYMAR ROYCE

Text: Close as any man would.
Speaker: WILL

Text: We should head back to the wall.
Speaker: GARED

Text: Do the dead frighten you?
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: Our orders were to track the wildlings. We tracked them. They won't trouble us no more.
Speaker: GARED

Text: You don't think he'll ask us how they died? Get back on your horse.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: [GARED grumbles.]
Whatever did it to them could do it to us. They even killed the children.
Speaker: WILL

Text: It's a good thing we're not children. You want to run away south, run away. Of course, they will behead you as a deserter É?? If I don't catch you first. Get back on your horse. I won't say it again.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: [WILL glares, but obeys. Sometime later, the three Rangers return to the campsite, which is now completely cleared.]
Your dead men seem to have moved camp.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: They were here.
Speaker: WILL

Text: See where they went.
Speaker: GARED

Text: [The three look around, swords drawn. They hear the wind and eerie calls. GARED finds a red cloth in the snow.]
What is it?
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: It's É??
Speaker: GARED

Text: [As he speaks, a CREATURE with glowing blue eyes rises behind ROYCE. ROYCE turns, the CREATURE strikes. The scene shifts to WILL, who hears a man crying out. The three horses stampede past him. He turns and sees someone standing very still in the distance. The figure turns É?? it's the child who had been suspended in the tree, now with glowing blue eyes. WILL turns and runs.

GARED is also fleeing, and we hear strange growls and catch glimpses of the CREATURE. Both terrified RANGERS stop, some distance apart, to catch their breath. WILL sees a CREATURE behead GARED. WILL sinks to his knees and the CREATURE tosses GARED'S head to him.]
[Blackout]

TITLE SEQUENCE[Riders from Winterfell come up behind a dazed WILL. The scene shifts to the castle, where BRAN is practicing archery and getting frustrated, under the eyes of JON SNOW and ROBB STARK. JON pats BRAN'S shoulder.]
Go on. Father's watching.
Speaker: JON

Text: [We see NED and CATELYN STARK watching from above.]
And your mother.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Scene shifts to needlework practice with the girls inside the castle.]
Fine work, as always. Well done.
Speaker: SEPTA MORDANE (to SANSA)

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I love the detail that you've managed to get in this corners. É?? Quite beautiful É?? the stitching É??
Speaker: SEPTA MORDANE

Text: [As she murmurs to SANSA about the embroidery, ARYA struggles with her needlework and listens to the arrows hitting and the male laughter outside.]
[Outside, BRAN tries and misses again. Everyone laughs.]
And which one of you was a marksman at ten? Keep practicing, Bran. Go on.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Don't think too much, Bran.
Speaker: JON

Text: Relax your bow arm.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [BRAN pulls the arrow back. An arrow hits the bullseye. BRAN (still with his arrow), JON, and ROBB turn in surprise to see ARYA, who curtsies after her perfect shot. ROBB and JON laugh as Bran takes out after ARYA.]
Quick, Bran, faster!
Speaker: JON/ROBB

Text: [RODRICK CASSEL and THEON GREYJOY approach NED and CATELYN on the balcony.]
Lord Stark. My lady. A guardsman just rode in from the hills. They've captured a deserter from the Night's Watch.
Speaker: CASSEL

Text: [NED grimaces.]
Get the lads to saddle their horses.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [THEON departs.]
Do you have to?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: He swore an oath, Cat.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The law is law, my lady.
Speaker: CASSEL

Text: Tell Bran he's coming, too.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [CASSEL nods and departs.]
Ned. Ten is too young to see such things.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: He won't be a boy forever. And winter is coming.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [NED departs. In the courtyard, ROBB and JON gather the arrows. CATELYN turns and glares down on JON. He looks at her and walks away.]
Lad, go run back and get the rest.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [Scene shifts, and we see WILL being taken to the block.]
White Walkers. I saw the White Walkers. White Walkers. The White Walkers, I saw them.
Speaker: WILL (muttering)

Text: [He and NED face each other.]

I know I broke my oath. And I know I'm a deserter. I should have gone back to the Wall and warned them. But I saw what I saw. I saw the White Walkers. People need to know. If you can get word to my family, tell them I'm no coward. Tell them I'm sorry.
Speaker: WILL

Text: NED nods yes, and WILL is positioned on the tree limb that serves as a block. [NED draws Ice from a scabbard held by Theon.]
Forgive me, lord.
Speaker: WILL (whispering)

Text: [NED bows his head over ICE.]
In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, first of his name É??
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Don't look away.
Speaker: JON (to BRAN)

Text: King of the Andals and the First Men É??
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Father will know if you do.
Speaker: JON

Text: Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and protector of the realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [NED swings ICE and beheads WILL. BRAN does not look away.]
You did well.
Speaker: JON

Text: [He walks away. ROBB turns and puts his arm around BRAN and they go to their horses together. NED approaches BRAN.]
You understand why I did it?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jon said he was a deserter.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: But do you understand why I had to kill him?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Our way is the old way?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Is it true he saw the White Walkers?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: So he was lying?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: A madman sees what he sees.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [Scene shifts to a dead stag's head. The Winterfell men gather on the bridge They see a ravaged deer before them.]
What is it?
Speaker: JON

Text: Mountain lion?
Speaker: THEON

Text: There are no mountain lions in these woods.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [With swords out, they begin to search. NED finds a dead direwolf with antlers through her throat. Her pups are whimpering around her.]
It's a freak.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It's a direwolf.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [NED and CASSEL glance at each other.]
Tough old beast.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [He pulls out the antlers.]
There are no direwolves south of the Wall.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Now there are five.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Jon picks up a pup and offers it to BRAN.]
You want to hold it?
Speaker: JON

Text: Where will they go? Their mother's dead.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: They don't belong down here.
Speaker: CASSEL

Text: Better a quick death. They won't last without their mother.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Right. Give it here.
Speaker: THEON

Text: NO!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Put away your blade.
Speaker: ROBB (disgustedly to THEON)

Text: I take orders from your father, not you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Please, father!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I'm sorry, Bran.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Lord Stark? There are five pups. One for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. They were meant to have them.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Everyone looks at NED, BRAN with great hope.]
You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [BRAN cradles his pup as JON hands more pups to ROBB.]
What about you?
Speaker: BRAN (to JON)

Text: I'm not a Stark. Get on.
Speaker: JON

Text: [JON walks away, pauses, and hears another whimper.]
What is it?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [JON pulls up a white wolf pup.]
The runt of the litter. That one's yours, Snow.
Speaker: THEON

Text: [Scene shifts to bells ringing at Kings Landing. In front of the Iron Throne, surrounded by druidical looking celebrants, lies the body of JON ARRYN. Up in the balcony, CERSEI watches the scene below as JAIME approaches.]
As your brother, I feel it's my duty to warn you: You worry too much. It's starting to show.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And you never worry about anything. When we were seven, you jumped off the cliffs as Casterly Rock. One hundred foot drop into the water. And you were never afraid.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There was nothing to be afraid of until you told father. [In a whisper, mimicking] We're Lannisters. Lannisters don't act like fools.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What if Jon Arryn told someone?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: But who would he tell?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My husband.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If he told the king, both our heads would be skewered on the city gates by now. Whatever Jon Arryn knew or didn't know, it died with him. And Robert will choose a new Hand of the king, someone to do his job while he's off fucking boars and hunting whores. Or is it the other way around? And life will go on.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You should be the Hand of the king.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: That's an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [Scene shifts to a raven approaching Winterfell. CATELYN crosses a busy courtyard and finds NED in the godswood.]
All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You have five northern children. You're not an outsider.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I wonder if the old gods agree.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It's your gods with all the rules.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I am so sorry, my love.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Tell me.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: There was a raven from Kings Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him. I know he was like a father to you.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Your sister. The boy É??
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: They both have their health. Gods be good. [pause] The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell. With the queen and all the rest of them.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: He's coming this far North, there's only one thing he's after.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You can always say no, Ned.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [Scene shifts to the Winterfell great hall where a great banquet is being prepared.]
We need plenty of candles for Lord Tyrion's chamber. I'm told he reads all night.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'm told he drinks all night.
Speaker: MAESTER LUWIN

Text: How much could he possibly drink? A man of his É?? stature.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: We've brought up eight barrels of ale from the cellar. Perhaps we'll find out.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: In any case, candles.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [Scene shifts to Robb, Theon, and Jon getting barbered.]
Why's your mother so dead-set on us getting pretty for the king?
Speaker: JON

Text: It's for the queen, I bet. I hear she's [sleek as a mink?]
Speaker: THEON

Text: I hear the prince is a right royal prick.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Think of all those southern girls he gets to stab with his right royal prick.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Go on, Tommy, shave him good. He's never met a girl he likes better than his own hair.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [Scene shifts to the royal procession approaching Winterfell. Bran sees them from his perch high atop a castle wall and clambers nimbly down to tell everyone. CATELYN and LUWIN walk to the courtyard, passing BRAN's wolf pup.]
Gods, but they grow fast. [Seeing BRAN on the wall] Brandon!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I saw the king! He's got hundreds of people!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: How many times have I told you: No climbing!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: But he's coming right now! Down our road!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I want you to promise me: No more climbing.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I promise.
Speaker: BRAN (looking down)

Text: D'you know what?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: What?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You always look at your feet before you lie. Run and find your father. Tell him the king is close.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [BRAN runs off, followed by his wolf pup.]

[Scene shifts to grand entry of the king's horses and men. ARYA, wearing a helm and cloak, pushes her way into a tall wagon for a better look. In rides JOFFREY, followed by the HOUND. The other Starks wait in a greeting line.]
Where's Arya? Sansa, where's your sister?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [More riders with banners. ARYA scoots past her parents to get in the receiving line.]
Hey,, hey, hey, hey. What are you doing with that on? [Pulls off ARYA's helm]
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Move!
Speaker: ARYA (pushing BRAN)

Text: [JOFFREY rides up, SANSA smiles at him, ROBB glares at JOFFREY. The HOUND pulls up his helm. The coach carrying CERSEI lumbers in, followed by KING ROBERT. All kneel. ROBERT heaves himself off his horse. NED looks shocked at the sight of his old friend, now fat and red-faced. ROBERT signals for all to rise and looks at NED.]
Your Grace.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You've got fat.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [NED gives ROBERT a É??What about you?É?ù look. They start laughing.]
Cat!
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Nine years. Why haven't I seen you? Where the hell have you been?
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: Guarding the North for you, Your Grace. Winterfell is yours.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [CERSEI and her other children descend from the coach.]
Where's the Imp?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Will you shut up?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Who have we here? You must be Robb. (To Sansa) My, you're a pretty one. (To Arya) Your name is?
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: Arya.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ROBERT (to BRAN) Ooh. Show us your muscles. You'll be a soldier.
[JAIME removes his helm.]
That's Jaime Lannister. The queen's twin brother.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Would you please shut up.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: [CERSEI approaches.]
My queen.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: My queen.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Take me to your crypt. I want to pay my respects.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: We've been riding for a month, my love. Surely the dead can wait.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ned.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: Where's the Imp?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [CERSEI, humiliated in front of all, walks back to JAIME.]
Where is our brother? Go find the little beast.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Scene changes to the crypt.]
Tell me about Jon Arryn.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: One minute he was fine, and then É?? Burned right through him, whatever it was. I loved that man.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: We both did.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He never had to teach you much, but me É?? You remember me at 16? All I wanted to do was crack skulls and fuck girls. He showed me what was what.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: Aye.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Don't look at me like that. Not his fault I didn't listen. (They laugh. ROBERT sighs.) I need you, Ned. Down at Kings Landing. Not up here, where you're no damn use to anybody. Lord Ned Stark, I would name you the Hand of the king.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [NED kneels.]
I'm not worthy of the honor.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I'm not trying to honor you. I'm trying to get you to run my kingdom while I eat, drink, and whore my way to an early grave. Damn it, Ned, stand up. You helped me win the Iron Throne, now help me keep the damn thing. We were meant to rule together. If your sister had lived, we would have been bound by blood. Well, it's not too late. I have a son, you have a daughter. We'll join our Houses.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [Scene changes to JAIME in the Winterfell settlement. We see Tyrion inside a whorehouse, swilling liquor and laughing as a woman pops into view after servicing him.]
Mmh. It is true what they say about the Northern girls.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Did you hear the king's in Winterfell?
Speaker: ROS

Text: I did hear something about that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And the queen. And her twin brother. They say that he is the most handsome man in the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: ROS

Text: And the other brother?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The queen has two brothers?
Speaker: ROS

Text: There's the pretty one. And there's the clever one.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I hear they call him the Imp.
Speaker: ROS

Text: I hear he hates that nickname.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh? I hear he's more than earned it. I hear he's a drunken little lecher into all manner of perversions.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Clever girl.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We've been expecting you, Lord Tyrion.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Have you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The gods gave me one blessing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [She climbs on TYRION. JAIME walks in without knocking.]
Don't get up.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: M'lord.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Should I explain to you the meaning of a closed door in a whorehouse, brother?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You've much to teach me, no doubt. But our sister craves your attention.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She has odd cravings, our sister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A family trait. Now, the Starks are feasting us at sundown. Don't leave me alone with these people.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm sorry, I've begun the feast a bit early. And this is the first of many courses.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I thought you might say that. But since we're short on time, (he opens the door; a bevy of whores enter and descend on TYRION) Come on, girls. See you at sundown.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [JAIME leaves.]
Close the door!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Scene changes to the Winterfell crypt, at Lyanna's tomb. [Robert places a feather in the hand of her statue.]
Did you have to bury her in a place like this? She should be on a hill somewhere with the sun and the clouds above her.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: She was my sister. This is where she belongs.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: She belonged with me.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [He touches Lyanna's face.]
In my dreams, I kill him every night.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: It's done, Your Grace. The Targaryens are gone.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Not all of them.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [Scene shifts to Daenerys on a balcony in Pentos, across the Narrow Sea.]
Daenerys!
Speaker: VISERYS (off camera)

Text: [He enters a large chamber.]
Daenerys! There's our bride to be! Look É?? a gift from Illyrio. Touch it. Come on. Feel the fabric. Mmmm. Isn't he a gracious host?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: We've been his guests for over a year and he's never asked us for anything.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Illyrio is no fool. He knows I won't forget my friends when I come into my throne. You still slouch. Let me see. (He pulls off her gown.) You have a woman's body now. (She endures it as he strokes her breast.) I need you to be perfect today. Can you do that for me? You don't want to wake the dragon, do you?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: No.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [VISERYS nods and starts to leave the chamber. He turns.]
When they write the history of my reign, sweet sister, they will say it began today.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: [Daenerys turns and steps into a steaming hot bath with a despairing look on her face.]
It's too hot, my lady.
Speaker: MAID

Text: [But DAENERYS keeps stepping deeper. The scene shifts to ILLYRIOS, DAENERYS, AND VISERYS outside the mansion, awaiting Khal Drogo.]
Where is he?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: The Dothraki are not known for their punctuality.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: [A host of Dothraki come riding up. Khal Drogo wheels his stallion into the front.]

(Greets them in Dothraki.) May I present my honored guests? Viserys of House Targaryen, the third of his name. The rightful King of the Andals and the First Men. And his sister, Daenerys, of the House Targaryen.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: VISERYS (to DAENERYS) Do you see how long his hair is? When Dothraki are defeated in combat, they cut off their braid so the whole world can see their shame. Khal Drogo has never been defeated. He's a savage, of course, but he's one of the finest killers alive. And you will be his queen.
Come forward, my dear.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: [KHAL DROGO watches as DAENERYS walks toward him. She does not hesitate and looks straight at him, although there is fear on her face. KHAL DROGO gazes at her and then leads his horsemen on a charge away.]
Where's he going?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: The ceremony is over.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: But he didn't say anything. Did he like her?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: Trust me, Your Grace. If he didn't like her, we'd know.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: [The scene shifts to ILLYRIO, VISERYS, AND DAENERYS ON A GARDEN BALCONY OVERLOOKING THE SEA.]
It won't be long now. Soon you will cross the Narrow Sea and take back your father's throne. The people drink secret toasts to your health. They cry out for their true king.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: When will they be married?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: Soon. The Dothraki never stay still for long.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: Is it true they lie with their horses?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: I wouldn't ask Khal Drogo.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: Do you take me for a fool?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: I take you for a king. Kings lack the caution of common men. My apologies if I've given offense.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: I know how to play a man like Drogo. I give him a queen and he gives me an army.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: DAENERYS (pleadingly) I don't want to be his queen. I want to go home.
So do I. I want us both to go home. But they took it from us. So tell me, sweet sister, how do we go home?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo's army. I would let his whole tribe fuck you, all 40,000 men and their horses too, if that's what it took.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: [He gives DAENERYS a brotherly kiss on the forehead and walks away. The scene shifts to a bedroom in Winterfell, where CATELYN is fixing SANSA'S hair.]
Do you think Joffrey will like me? What if he thinks I'm ugly?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Then he is the stupidest prince that ever lived.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: He's so handsome.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: [CATELYN rolls her eyes.]
When would we be married? Soon or do we have to wait?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Hush now. Your father hasn't even said yes.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Why would he say no? He'd be the second most powerful man in the kingdoms.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He'd have to leave home. He'd have to leave me. And so would you.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You left your home to come here. And I'd be queen someday. Please make father say yes.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SansaÉ??
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Please, please. It's the only thing I ever wanted.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: [Scene shifts to the Winterfell banquet. Laughter, music, KING ROBERT getting bawdy with a wench. CATELYN and CERSEI watch, CATELYN embarrassed for CERSEI, who looks disgusted. Out in the courtyard, JON takes out his frustration on a fencing dummy. His uncle BENJEN rides up.]
Is he dead yet?
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: Uncle Benjen!
Speaker: JON

Text: [They hug.]
You got bigger. I rode all day. Didn't want to leave you alone with the Lannisters. Why aren't you at the feast?
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: Lady Stark thought it might insult the royal family to seat a bastard in their midst.
Speaker: JON

Text: Well, you're always welcome on the wall. No bastard was ever refused a seat there.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: So take me with you when you go back.
Speaker: JON

Text: JonÉ??
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: Father will let me if you ask him, I know he will.
Speaker: JON

Text: The Wall isn't going anywhere.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: I'm ready to swear your oath.
Speaker: JON

Text: You don't understand what you'd be giving up. We have no families. None of us will ever father sons.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: I don't care about that.
Speaker: JON

Text: You might, if you knew what it meant. É?? I'd better get inside. Rescue your father from his guests. We'll talk later.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: [BENJEN goes to the banquet.]
Your uncle's in the Night's Watch.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What're you doing back there?
Speaker: JON

Text: Preparing for a night with your family. I've always wanted to see the Wall.
Speaker: TYRION (drinking)

Text: You're Tyrion Lannister. The queen's brother?
Speaker: JON

Text: My greatest accomplishment. You É?? you're Ned Stark's bastard, aren't you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [JON looks angry and turns away.]
Did I offend you? Sorry. You are the bastard, though.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Lord Ned Stark is my father.
Speaker: JON

Text: And Lady Stark is not your mother. Making you a bastard. Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget what you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armor. Then it can never be used to hurt you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What the hell do you know about being a bastard?
Speaker: JON

Text: All dwarves are bastards in their fathers' eyes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [TYRION departs. JON picks up his sword and attacks the dummy with new ferocity.]
[The scene shifts back to the banquet, in full raucous swing. NED is off to himself; BENJEN comes up to him.]
The boy I beheaded. Did you know him?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Of course I did. Just a lad. But he was tough, Ned. A true Ranger.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: He was talking madness. Said the Walkers slaughtered his friends.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The two he was with are still missing.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: A wildling ambush.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Maybe. Direwolves south of the wall. Talk of the Walkers. My brother might be the next Hand to the king. Winter is coming.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: Winter is coming.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: [ROBB approaches.]
Uncle Benjen.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb boy. How are ye?
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: I'm good.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [KING ROBERT gets even more bawdy with a wench.]
CATELYN (in desperation) Is this your first time in the North, Your Grace?
Yes. Lovely country.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [They observe SANSA.]
I'm sure it's very grim, after Kings Landing. I remember how scared I was when Ned brought me up here for the first time.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [SANSA approaches and smiles shyly at CERSEI.]
Hello, little dove. But you are a beauty. How old are you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Thirteen, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're tall. Still growing?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I think so, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And have you bled yet?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA (discomfited)

Text: And your dress. Did you make it?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [SANSA nods yes.]
Such talent. You must make something for me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [SANSA departs.]
I hear we might share a grandchild someday.
Speaker: CERSEI (to CATELYN)

Text: I hear the same.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Your daughter will do well in the capital. Such a beauty shouldn't stay hidden up here forever.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [SANSA and JOFFREY catch each other's eye. JOFFREY smiles at her and she turns to her friend.]
[JAIME and NED meet up. JAIME blocks their path.]
Your pardon.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I hear we might be neighbors soon. I hope it's true.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, the king has honored me with his offer.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I'm sure we'll have a tournament to celebrate the new title, if you accept. It would be good to have you in the field. The competition has become a bit stale.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't fight in tournaments.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No? Getting a little old for it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't fight in tournaments because when I fight a man for real, I don't want him to know what I can do.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Well said.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [ARYA flips food onto SANSA's face.]
Arya!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: [CATELYN signals a laughing ROBB to deal with the girls. He hoists up ARYA.]
Time for bed.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [The scene shifts to after the banquet. NED and CATELYN are in their bed.]
I'm a Northman. I belong here with you, not down south in that rat's nest they call a capital.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I won't let him take you.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The king takes what he wants. That's why he's king.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I'll say, É??Listen, fat man, you are not taking my husband anywhere. He belongs to me now.'
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: How did he get so fat?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He only stops eating when it's time for a drink.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [There's a knock at the door.]
It's Maester Luwin, my lord.
Speaker: A VOICE

Text: Send him in.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Pardon, my lord, my lady. A rider in the night from your sister.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: [He hands CATELYN a sealed note.]
Stay.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: This was sent from the Eyrie. What's she doing at the Eyrie? She hasn't been back there since her wedding.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [CATELYN reads the note, looks up in alarm, and then burns it.]
What news?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: She's fled the capital. She says Jon Arryn was murdered. By the Lannisters. She says the king is in danger.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: She's fresh widowed, Cat. She doesn't know what she's saying.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Lysa's head would be on a spike right now if the wrong people had found that letter. Do you think she would risk her life, her son's life, if she wasn't certain her husband was murdered?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: If this news is true, and the Lannisters conspire against the throne, who but you can protect the king?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: They murdered the last Hand. Now you want Ned to take the job.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The king rode for a month to ask Lord Stark's help. He's the only one he trusts. You swore the king an oath, my lord.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: He spent half his life fighting Robert's wars. He owes him nothing. (To NED) Your father and brother rode south once on a king's demand.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: A different time. Different king.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: [The scene shifts to the wild wedding celebration of KHAL DROGO and DAENERYS. Fighting and fornication. DAENERYS looks stricken at everything around her.]
When do I meet with the Khal? We need to begin planning the invasion.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: If Khal Drogo has promised you a crown, you shall have it.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: When?
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: When their omens favor war.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: I piss on Dothraki omens. I waited 17 years to get my throne back.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: [The sex and violence intensify. Two men fight to the death over a woman each is trying to rape. KHAL DROGO watches avidly.]
A Dothraki wedding without at least three deaths is considered a dull affair.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: [A knight in Westerosi garb appears. KHAL DROGO greets him in Dothraki. It is JORAH MORMONT, bearing books.]
A small gift for the new Khaleesi. Songs and histories from the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Thank you, ser. Are you from my country?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Ser Jorah Mormont of Bear Island. I served your father for many years. Gods be good, I hope to always serve the rightful king.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [DANY is presented with a chest with three dragon eggs in it.]
Dragons' eggs, Daenerys. From the Shadow Lands beyond Asshai. The ages have turned them to stone, but they will always be beautiful.
Speaker: ILLYRIO

Text: Thank you, Magister.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [KHAL DROGO rises and strides forward. DAENERYS follows him, looking sick with fear. The Dothraki crowd behind her as she goes. The KHAL leads her to a white mare.]
She's beautiful. É?? Ser Jorah, I don't know how to say É??thank you' in Dothraki.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: There is no word for É??thank you' in Dothraki.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [The KHAL puts DANY on her horse and mounts his.]
Make him happy.
Speaker: VISERYS

Text: [The scene shifts to the seaside at sunset. The KHAL begins to unwrap DANY's dress. She is sobbing. He touches the tears on her face.]
No.
Speaker: KHAL DROGO

Text: Do you know the Common Tongue?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No.
Speaker: KHAL DROGO

Text: Is É??no' the only word that you know?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No.
Speaker: KHAL DROGO

Text: [He takes off her gown and bends her down.]
[The scene shifts to Winterfell. Tyrion and the Hound are seated outside the day after the banquet.]
Rough night, Imp?
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: If I get through this without squirting from one end or the other, it will be a miracle.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn't pick you for a hunter.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: The greatest in the land. My spear never misses.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's not hunting if you pay for it.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [The king and Ned come into view.]
Are you as good with a spear as you used to be?
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: No, but I'm still better than you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I know what I'm putting you through. Thank you for saying yes. I only ask you because I need you. You're a loyal friend. You hear me? A loyal friend. The last one I've got.
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: I hope I'll serve you well.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You will. And I'll make sure you don't look so fucking grim all the time. Come on, boys, let's go kill some boar!
Speaker: ROBERT

Text: [The king's party rides off, NED nodding goodbye to BRAN, whose wolf pup begins sniffing at his feet.]
Come on, you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [BRAN begins climbing, his wolf pup crying at the bottom of the castle wall. As he nears the top, he hears a woman and man moaning. Peering in the window, he sees CERSEI and JAIME having sex. CERSEI sees BRAN.]
Stop. STOP.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [JAIME runs and grabs BRAN at the window.]
Are you completely mad?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He saw us.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's all right. It's all right.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He saw us!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I heard you the first time. (To BRAN) Quite the little climber, aren't you? How old are you, boy?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ten
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Ten.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [JAIME looks at CERSEI, who gazes back imploringly.]
The things I do for love.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [He shoves BRAN out the window.]
/ BLACKOUT /

We begin where É??BaelorÉ?ù left off; after the execution of Ned Stark, we see Ilyn Payne's bloodied sword and the Hound picking up Ned's head to show it to the rapturous townsfolk. We then pan to Arya, her eyes closed and her face pressed against Yoren's chest.
Look at me. Look at me! Do you remember me now, boy, eh? Remember me? There's a bright boy. You'll be coming with me, boy, and you'll be keeping your mouth shut.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Yoren takes Arya with him away from the mob and into a flight of stairs; on the courtyard, Sansa faints.
Keep your mouth shut, boy. (takes out a knife)
Speaker: Yoren

Text: l'm not a boy!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You're not a smart boy, is that what you're trying to say? Do you want to live, boy?! (starts cutting Arya's hair as the screams and shouts from the crowd are heard above) North, boy, we're going north.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: At Winterfell, Bran has a dream in which he can walk and sees a three-eyed raven. He then talks about this dream with Osha.
lt had three eyes. lt told me to come with him, so l did. We went down into the crypts and my father was there.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Your father's not down there, little lord. Not for many years yet.
Speaker: Osha

Text: You're afraid. Just like Hodor.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: l'm not afraid of some hole in the ground.
Speaker: Osha

Text: You've lived beyond the Wall. What are you scared of? l'm a crippled boy and l'm willing to go.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Osha takes Bran to the crypts. She carries him with her arms while he lights the way with a torch.

That's my grandfather, Lord Rickard. He was burned alive by the Mad King, Aerys. That's Lyanna, my father's sister. King Robert was supposed to marry her, but Rhaegar Targaryen kidnapped her. Robert started a war to win her back. He killed Rhaegar, but she died anyway. That's where l saw Father.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: You see? He's not here.
Speaker: Osha

Text: A loud roar is heard and a shadow moves in front of them. A direwolf runs towards them; Osha falls to the ground with him. We see Shaggydog barking at them viciously.
Here, Shaggydog.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: Rickon!
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: That beast is supposed to be chained in the kennels!
Speaker: Osha

Text: He doesn't like chains.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: What are you doing down here? Come back up with us.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: No, l came to see Father.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: How many times have l told you? He's in King's Landing with Sansa and Arya.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: He was down here. l saw him.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: Saw him when?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Last night, when l was sleeping. Here, Shaggydog.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: Rickon leaves with Shaggydog, while Osha looks puzzled at Bran. We cut to a shot of her carrying him outside.
You both miss him. lt's only natural he should be in your thoughts and dreams, but that doesn't mean that É??
Speaker: Osha

Text: BranÉ??
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Catelyn Stark walks alone through the Stark camp. Several bannermen bow to her respectfully as she passes.
My lady. My lady. My lady.
Speaker: Several Stark Bannermen

Text: She reaches a small forest outside camp and collapses in grief by one of the trees, crying and sobbing. She hears some screams and the sound of a sword slashing wood nearby. As she gets closer, she realizes it's Robb, fully armoured, slashing his sword against a tree while crying.
Robb. Robb! You've ruined your sword.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Robb drops his sword to the ground and goes to Catelyn. She hugs him and caresses his neck, trying to console him.
Shh! Shh! Shh!
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l'll kill them all. Every one of them. l will kill them all.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: My boy. They have your sisters. We have to get the girls back. And then we will kill them all.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: At the Throne Room on the Red Keep, Marillion the bard is singing a song for Joffrey and his retinue. Cercei stands by his side, while Sansa overlooks the scene from one of the colonnades.
(singing)
Speaker: Marillion

Text: The boar's great tusks, they boded ill
For good King Robert's health
And the beast was every bit as fat
As Robert was himself
But our brave king cried,
"Do your worst!
l'll have your ugly head!
You're nowhere near as murd'rous as
the lion in my bed"
King Robert lost his battle and
He failed his final test,
The lion ripped his balls off,
And the boar did all the rest.
Very amusing. lsn't it a funny song? Thank you for your rendition. l imagine it was even better received at that tavern.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: l'm so sorry, Your Grace. l'll never sing it again, l swear.
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Your Grace?
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Sansa looks at Joffrey, despondent.
Fingers or your tongue? lf you got to keep one, which would it be? Or l could just cut your throat.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Every man needs hands, Your Grace.
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Good. Tongue it is.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Your Grace, please. l won't sing, Your Grace.
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Ser llyn, who better than you to carry out the sentence?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: l beg you! Please, no. No!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Ilyn Payne marches towards the fire to heat up his dagger.
Your Grace, please. l beg you, l will never sing again! (screaming) No!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: l'm done for the day. l'll leave the rest of the matters to you, Mother.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: (screaming) Your Grace, please!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: As Joffrey leaves with Meryn Trant and the Hound, he passes by Sansa. Marillion is still screaming and begging in the background.
You look quite nice.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Thank you, my lord.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Your Grace. l'm King now.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: (screaming) Stop! No!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Walk with me. l want to show you something.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Do as you're bid, child.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Joffrey and Sansa are outside, walking past across a row of spears in the Red Keep. Trant and Clegane follow behind them.
And as soon as you've had your blood, l'll put a son in you. Mother says that shouldn't be long.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: The pikes have impaled heads on them. Sansa looks away.
No! Please, no!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: (pointing at one of the heads) This one's your father. This one here. Look at it and see what happens to traitors.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: You promised to be merciful.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: l was. l gave him a clean death. Look at him.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Please let me go home. l won't do any treason, l swear É??
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Mother says l'm still to marry you. So you'll stay here, and obey. Look at him!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Sansa looks up at the head of her father.
Well?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: How long do l have to look?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: As long as it pleases me. Do you want to see the rest?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: lf it please Your Grace.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: That's your Septa there. (shot of the impaled head of a woman with the traditional Septa headscarf) l'll tell you what, l'm going to give you a present. After l raise my armies and kill your traitor brother, l'm going to give you his head as well.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Or maybe he'll give me yours. (looks defiantly at Joffrey, who cowers)
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: My mother tells me a king should never strike his lady. Ser Meryn.Ser Meryn strikes Sansa repeatedly with the back of his (armoured) hand, leaving her lip bloodied. Sansa notices the stone bridge Joffrey is on leads to a street some feet below. She moves forward to lunge him from the edge, but she's stopped by the Hound.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Here, girl. (cleans her bloody lip with a rag)
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Will you obey now? Or do you need another lesson? l'll look for you in court.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Save yourself some pain, girl. Give him what he wants.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Sansa tries to give him is handkerchief back.
You'll be needing that again.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Sandor leaves, leaving Sansa alone at the bridge. She looks at the heads atop the pikes and cries.
War meeting at the Stark camp. They sit at the table at night by torchlight.
Renly is not the king.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You cannot mean to hold to Joffrey, my lord. He put your father to death.
Speaker: Jonos Bracken

Text: That doesn't make Renly king. He's Robert's youngest brother. lf Bran can't be Lord of Winterfell before me, Renly can't be king before Stannis.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Do you mean to declare us for Stannis?
Speaker: Jonos Bracken

Text: Renly is not right! lf we put ourselves behind StannisÉ??
Speaker: Galbart Glover

Text: l'll have peace on those terms. They can keep their Red Castle and their iron chair too. (bows to Robb and extends him his sword) The King in the North!
Speaker: Rickard Karstark

Text: Am l your brother, now and always?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Now and always.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: (takes out his sword, bows to Robb) My sword is yours in victory and defeat, from this day until my last day.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: The King in the North!
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: (chanting)  The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: All

Text: They all take out their swords and swear fealty to Robb as Catelyn looks wearily at the whole scene.
(chanting)  The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: All

Text: Catelyn goes to the outskirts of their camp, to the dungeons where prisoners are being kept.
Lady Stark.
Speaker: Stark Guard

Text: l want to see him. Now! Leave us.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: They walk for a while until they reach a single prisoner (Jaime), kept away far from the rest.
Leave us. (the guards leave)
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: You look lovely tonight, Lady Stark. Widowhood becomes you. (Catelyn grabs a large rock from the ground)  Your bed must be lonely. ls that why you came? l'm not at my best, but l think l could be of service. You slip out of that gown and we'll see if l'm up to it. (She marches towards him and hits the rock against his forehead)   Oh, l do like a violent woman.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: l will kill you tonight, Ser. Pack your head in a box and send it to your sister.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Let me show you how. Hit me again, over the ear. And again and again. You're stronger than you look, it shouldn't take long.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: That is what you want the world to believe, isn't it? That you don't fear death.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: But l don't, my lady. The dark is coming for all of us. Why cry about it?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Because you are going to the deepest of the seven hells, if the gods are just.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: What gods are those? The trees your husband prayed to? Where were the trees when his head was getting chopped off? lf your gods are real and if they are just why is the world so full of injustice?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Because of men like you.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: There are no men like me. Only me.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: My son Bran. How did he come to fall from that tower?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l pushed him out the window.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Why?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I hoped the fall would kill him.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Why?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: You should get some sleep. lt's going to be a long war. (Catelyn drops the rock and goes away)
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Cersei and Lancel are having one of their rendezvous on her bedchamber. Cersei is reading a message while Lancel speaks, naked.
l can't believe we're actually at war. Was it this exciting last time, when you were young? What does it say? Have we captured Robb Stark yet? What's our next move?
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: Stop talking. Get back into bed.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Back in the Riverlands, we sit with the Lannister war meeting. Tywin, Tyrion and Kevan are in assistance.
They have my son.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: The Stark boy appears to be less green than we'd hoped.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l've heard his wolf killed a dozen men and as many horses.
Speaker: Leo Lefford

Text: ls it true about Stannis and Renly?
Speaker: Addam Marbrand

Text: Both Baratheon brothers have taken up against us. Jaime captured, his armies scattered. lt's a catastrophe. Perhaps we should sue for peace.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: There's your peace. Joffrey saw to that when he decided to remove Ned Stark's head. You'll have an easier time drinking from that cup than you will bringing Robb Stark to the table now. He's winning É?? in case you hadn't noticed.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l'm told we still have his sisters.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: The first order of business is ransoming Ser Jaime.
Speaker: Leo Lefford

Text: Kevan Lannister:  First we must return to Casterly Rock to raise É??
Speaker: Addam Marbrand

Text: (shouting)  They have my son! Get out, all of you. (to Tyrion) Not you. You were right about Ned Stark. lf he were alive, we could have used him to broker a peace with Winterfell and Riverrun, which would have given us more time to deal with Robert's brothers. But now É?? madness. Madness and stupidity. l always thought you were a stunted fool. Perhaps l was wrong.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Half wrong. l'm new to strategy, but unless we want to be surrounded by three armies, it appears we can't stay here.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: No one will stay here. Ser Gregor will head out with 500 riders and set the Riverland on fire from God's Eye to the Red Fork. The rest of us will regroup at Harrenhal. And you will go to King's Landing.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: And do what?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Rule. You will serve as Hand of the King in my stead. You will bring that boy king to heel, and his mother too, if needs be. And if you get so much as a whiff of treason from any of the rest É?? Baelish, Varys, PycelleÉ??
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Heads, spikes, walls. Why not my uncle? Why not anyone? Why me?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're my son. Oh, one more thing. You will not take that whore to court. Do you understand?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys is sleeping inside a yurt. Jorah is sitting beside her when she wakes up.
Ser Jorah?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Gently, gently.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: My son É?? where is he? l want him. Where is he?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The boy did not live.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Tell me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: What is there to tell?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: How did my son die?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He never lived, my princess. The women say É??
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: What do the women say?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: They say the child was É??
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: (entering the tent) Monstrous, twisted. l pulled him out myself. He was scaled like a lizard, blind, with leather wings like the wings of a bat. When l touched him the skin fell from his bones. Inside he was full of graveworms. l warned you that only death can pay for life. You knew the price.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Where is Khal Drogo? Show him to me. Show me what l bought with my son's life.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: As you command, lady. Come. l will take you to him.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Time enough for that later É??
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: l want to see him now.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: They leave the tent/yurt, following Mirri Maz Duur to the place where Drogo is lying.
The khalasar is gone.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: A khal who cannot ride is no khal. The Dothraki follow only the strong. l'm sorry, my Princess.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Drogo! (in Dothraki) My sun and stars. (in the Common Tongue, to the rest) Why is he out here alone?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He seems to like the warmth, Princess.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He lives. You asked for life, you paid for life.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: (looking at Drogo's catatonic expression) This is not life. When will he be as he was?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: When the sun rises in the west, sets in the east. When the seas go dry. When the mountains blow in the wind like leaves.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Leave us.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: l don't want you alone with this sorceress.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: l have nothing more to fear from this woman. Go.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys and Mirri Maz Duur have a conversation alone.
You knew what l was buying and you knew the price.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: lt was wrong of them to burn my temple. lt angered the Great Shepherd.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: This is not God's work. My child was innocent.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: lnnocent? He would have been The Stallion Who Mounts The World. Now he will burn no cities. Now his khalasar will trample no nations into dust.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: l spoke for you. l saved you.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Saved me? Three of those riders had already raped me before you saved me, girl. l saw my god's house burn, there where l had healed men and women beyond counting. ln the streets l saw piles of heads, the head of the baker who makes my bread, the head of a young boy that l had cured of fever just three moons past. So tell me again exactly what it was that you saved?
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Your life.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Why don't you take a look at your khal. Then you will see exactly what life is worth when all the rest has gone.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: At Castle Black, Jon is preparing to leave in the night and desert the Night's Watch; Sam is there to try to talk him out of it.
You can't!
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Get out of my way, Sam.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: They'll put out the word. They'll send out ravens. People will come after you. Do you know what happens to deserters?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Better than you do.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: What are you going to do?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: l'm gonna find my brother and put a sword through King Joffrey's throat. (gets on horseback)
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You can't leave us now. We need you here.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Move.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l won't let you go.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Move.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: No.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Hyah!
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon rides his horse away from Castle Black, his horse kicking Sam to the ground as he was standing in the way. Ghost follows him out.
In the Lannister camp in the Riverlands, Tyrion and Shae are talking inside his tent about his recent appointment.
Hand of the King?
Speaker: Shae

Text: So it would seem.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: And your father said you couldn't take anyone with you to King's Landing?
Speaker: Shae

Text: No, he said l couldn't take  you with me to King's Landing. He was very specific on that point.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He knew my name?
Speaker: Shae

Text: What?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He said, "Don't bring Shae with you to King's Landing"?
Speaker: Shae

Text: l believe he used the word "whore".
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Are you ashamed of me? Are you afraid that l'm dancing around the court with my tits out?
Speaker: Shae

Text: Tyrion laughs.
I'm funny now? l'm Shae, the funny whore.
Speaker: Shae

Text: My father's probably the most powerful man in the country. Certainly the richest. He has all Seven Kingdoms in his pockets. Everyone everywhere always has to do exactly what my father says. He's always been a cunt. l believe the ladies of the court could learn a great deal from a girl like you. Why don't you come with me, be the Hand's lady? Because the King needs a Hand and the Hand É?? (Shae kisses Tyrion)
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l know what a Hand needs.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Jon and Ghost are being chased by his fellow Night's Watch brothers through a forest not long after he left.
Ghost?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Hyah! Hyah! Hyah! Hyah!
Speaker: Sam, Pyp, and Grenn

Text: During the chase, Sam hits his head on a tree branch and falls off his horse. The others and later Jon stop to assist him.
Samwell!
Speaker: Grenn

Text: ls he dead?
Speaker: Pyp

Text: No, he's not dead.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Did we get him?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Come on, help me get him up.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Lucky you've got plenty of padding. (to Jon)  We're taking you back to where you belong.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: l belong with my brother.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: But we're your brothers now.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: They'll kill you if they find out you've gone.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: They'll kill you if they know you came after me. Go back.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Sam told us everything. We're sorry about your father.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: But it doesn't matter. You took the oath. You can't leave.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: l have to.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You can't. You said the words.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: I don't care about É??
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: "Hear my words and bear witness to my vow"
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: To hell with all of you.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: "Night gathers and now my watch begins. lt shall not end until my death. l shall live and die at my post.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: "l am the sword in the darkness É?? "
Speaker: Grenn

Text: (in unison, reciting the vow) "l am the sword in the darkness, the watcher on the walls, the shield that guards the realms of men. l pledge my life and honor to the Night's Watch, for this night and all nights to come.É?ù
Speaker: Sam, Pyp, and Grenn

Text: Sam brings Longclaw to Jon, who accepts it.
Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys is tending to Drogo and his wounds inside a yurt.

(in Dothraki) Do you remember our first ride, my sun and stars? lf you are in there, if you haven't gone away, show me. You're a fighter. You've always been a fighter. l need you to fight now. l know you're very far away, but come back to me, my sun and stars.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: We cut to Daenerys standing with her head pressing against Drogo's chest, now visibly more distressed.
(crying)  When the sun rises in the west and sets in the east. Then you shall return to me, my sun and stars.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys kisses Drogo, then uses a pillow to smother him.
In King's Landing, Pycelle is having a conversation with someone (unseen at first) in his bedchambers.
Ros gets dressed while Pycelle keeps talking.

He is a capable young man. Strong military mind. Stern. But sternness in defense of the realm is no vice. lt's far too soon to know what manner of king he will be, but l sense true greatness on the horizon for our new King. Mmm. True greatness.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Ros is listening, but seems really bored by the whole thing.
So what's the thing?
Speaker: Ros

Text: What thing?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: About kings. You said, "The thing you need to understand about kings".
Speaker: Ros

Text: What? Things? What?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: When you started, youÉ?? Never mind.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Let me see you out, my dear.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: lt's all right. No need.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Yes, yes. Till the next time. (Pycelle gets off the bed and stretches his limbs with ease, belying his old age and general sickly demeanor) Right.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: He gets dressed in his robes and looks at himself in the mirror with pride. Before he leaves his chambers, he moves from an upright position to the hunchback he's always seen with in public. He's faking it.
In the Throne Room, Littlefinger and Varys have a chat overlooking the Iron Throne.
When you imagine yourself up there, how do you look? Does the crown fit? Do all the lords and ladies simper and bow, the ones who sneered at you for years?
Speaker: Varys

Text: lt's hard for them to simper and bow without heads.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: A man with great ambition and no moralsÉ?? l wouldn't bet against you.
Speaker: Varys

Text: And what would you do, my friend, if you found yourself sitting up there?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: l must be one of the few men in this city who doesn't want to be King.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You must be one of the few men in the city who isn't a man.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Oh, you can do better than that.
Speaker: Varys

Text: When they castrated you, did they take the pillar with the stones? l've always wondered.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Have you? Do you spend a lot of time wondering what's between my legs?
Speaker: Varys

Text: l picture a gash. Like a woman's. ls that about right?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: l am flattered, of course, to be pictured at all.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Must be strange for you, even after all these yearsÉ?? a man from another land, despised by most, feared by all.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Am l? That is good to know. Do you lie awake at night fearing my gash?
Speaker: Varys

Text: But you carry on whispering in one king's ear and then the next. l admire you.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: And l admire you, Lord Baelish. A grasper from a minor House with a major talent for befriending powerful men É?? and women.
Speaker: Varys

Text: A useful talent, l'm sure you'd agree.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: So here we stand in mutual admiration and respect.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Playing our roles.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: (Joffrey arrives, Varys bows)  Serving a new King.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Long may he reign. My king. (bows)
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: My king.
Speaker: Varys

Text: My lords. Shall we begin?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Elsewhere in King's Landing, Yoren is taking Arya to safety, away from the city.
You're Arry now, hear me? Arry the orphan boy. No one asks an orphan too many questions, É??cause nobody gives three shits. What's your name?
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Arry.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You've a long way to travel, and in bad company. l've 20 this time É??  men and boys all bound for the Wall. Your lord father gave me the pick of the dungeons, and l didn't find no little lordlings down there. This lot É?? half of them would turn you over to the King quick as spit for a pardon. And the other half would do the same, except they'd rape you first. So keep to yourself É?? and when you piss, do it in the woods alone. You stay with this lot, boy. And stay or l'll lock you in the back of the wagon with these three.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Arya bumps into a fat recruit, Hot Pie.
Watch yourself, midget.
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: He's got a sword, this one.
Speaker: Lommy Greenhands

Text: What's a gutter rat like you doing with a sword?
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: Maybe he's a little squire.
Speaker: Lommy Greenhands

Text: He ain't no squire. Look at him. He looks like a girl. l bet he stole that sword.
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: Let's have a look. (wrestles Arya to the ground)
Speaker: Lommy Greenhands

Text: l could use me a sword like that.
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: Take it off him.
Speaker: Lommy Greenhands

Text: Give it here, midget.
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: Look at him! You'd better give Hot Pie the sword. l've seen him kick a boy to death.
Speaker: Lommy Greenhands

Text: l knocked him down and l kicked him in the balls and l kept kicking him until he was dead. l kicked him all to pieces. You better give me that sword!
Speaker: Hot Pie

Text: (pointing Needle at Hot Pie) You want it? l'll give it to you. l already killed one fat boy. l bet you never killed anyone. l bet you're a liar. But l'm not. l'm good at killing fat boys. l like killing fat boys.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Hot Pie bumps into Gendry, Robert's bastard.

Your like picking on the little ones, do you? l've been hammering an anvil these past 10 years. When l hit that steel, it sings. Are you gonna sing when l hit you? (Hot Pie leaves, scared. Gendry talks to Arya alone) This is castle-forged steel. Where'd you steal it?
Speaker: Gendry

Text: lt was a gift.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: lt don't matter now. Where we're going, they don't care what you've done. They've got rapers, pickpockets, highwaymen, murderers.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: Which are you?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Armourer's apprentice. But my master got sick of me, so here l am.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: (shouting) Come on, you sorry sons of whores! lt's a thousand leagues from here to the Wall, and winter is coming!
Speaker: Yoren

Text: The caravan of the Night's Watch leaves the walls of King's Landing.
Back at Castle Black, Jon is serving Commander Mormont his breakfast.
Ham. How many days in a row must a man be expected to start his day with ham? Bring me some beer at least. You look exhausted. Was your moonlight ride that tiring?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: (Jon looks at the Lord Commander with surprise) Don't look so terrified. lf we beheaded everyone that ran away for the night, only ghosts would guard the Wall. At least you weren't whoring in Mole's Town. Honor made you leave, honor brought you back.
My friends brought me back.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l didn't say it was your honor.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: They killed my father.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: And you're gonna bring him back to life, are you? No? Good. We've had enough of that sort of thing. Beyond the Wall, the Rangers are reporting whole villages abandoned. At night they see fires blazing in the mountains from dusk until dawn. A captured wildling swears their tribes are uniting in some secret stronghold, to what ends the gods only know. Outside Eastwatch Cotter Pyke's men discovered four blue-eyed corpses. Unlike us, they were wise enough to burn them. Do you think your brother's war is more important than ours?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: No.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: When dead men and worse come hunting for us in the night, do you think it matters who sits on the lron Throne?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: No.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Good. Because l want you and your wolf with us when we ride out beyond the Wall tomorrow.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Beyond the Wall?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l'll not sit meekly by and wait for the snows. l mean to find out what's happening. The Night's Watch will ride in force against the wildlings, the White Walkers and whatever else is out there. And we will find Benjen Stark, alive or dead. l will command them myself. So l'll only ask you once, Lord Snow, are you a brother of the Night's Watch or a bastard boy who wants to play at war?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: The Men of the Night's Watch gather their forces at leave to range Beyond the Wall. Lord Commander Mormont leads them, with Jon amongst his brothers.
Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys is leading a ceremony for Drogo after his death.
(picking up the dragon eggs from their chest, speaking in Dothraki) ls this your command, Khaleesi? (Daenerys nods, Rakharo places the eggs next to Drogo's funeral pyre)
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Drogo will have no use for dragon eggs in the Night Lands. Sell them. You can return to the Free Cities and live as a wealthy woman for all your days.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: They were not given to me to sell.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Khaleesi, my Queen, l vow to serve you, obey you, to die for you if need be, but let him go, Khaleesi. l know what you intend. Do not.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: l must. You don't understand.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Don't ask me to stand aside as you climb on that pyre. l won't watch you burn.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: ls that what you fear? (kisses Jorah on the cheek, then speaks to the rest of the Dothraki and Lhazareen who stayed with her)  You will be my khalasar. l see the faces of slaves. l free you. Take off your collars. Go if you wish, no one will stop you. But if you stay it will be as brothers and sisters, as husbands and wives.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur is shown tied and bound by rope.
Ser Jorah, bind this woman to the pyre. You swore to obey me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (to the crowd)  l am Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen of the blood of old Valyria. I am the Dragon's daughter. And I swear to you that those who would harm you will die screaming.
You will not hear me scream.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: I will. But it is not your screams I want. Only your life.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys walks towards the pyre and lights it on fire with a torch. Mirri Maz Duur starts uttering some incantations which quickly turn into screaming. Daenerys walks into the burning pyre as her dress catches fire. The flames engulf everything, and the screen fades to black.

We then cut to the next day in the morning. Jorah goes to the pyre to see if there's anything left of it. Amidst the smoke, a naked Daenerys appears, covered in soot and carrying three baby dragons in her arms and back.
(bowing)  Blood of my blood.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Everyone else bows to her as her dragons start screeching. We cut to black over a final screech from one her dragons.
Daenerys on horseback looking at Drogo and his people.
You need to drink, child... And eat.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Isn't there anything else?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The Dothraki have two things in abundance: grass and horses. People can't live on grass... In the Shadow Lands beyond Asshai, they say there are fields of ghost grass with stalks as pale as milk that glow in the night. It murders all other grass. The Dothraki believe that one day it will cover everything. That's the way the world will endÉ?? It'll get easier.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Arriving at camp, Daenerys looks exhausted from riding.
Khaleesi!
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Your hands.
Speaker: Irri

Text: After Daenerys is escorted away, Jorah and Viserys are alone.
We're still not far from Pentos, your Grace. Magister Illyrio has extended his hospitality. You'd be more comfortable there.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: I have no interest in hospitality or comfort. I'll stay with Drogo until he fulfils his end of the bargain and I have my crown.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: As you wish, your Grace.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Well, Mormont, as brutish as this life is, I suppose it is preferable to beheading. What did Ned Stark want you for? Buying from a slaver?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Selling to one... Some poachers I caught on my land.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Under my reign, you won't be punished for such nonsense. You can rest assured of that.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Joffrey finding Tyrion asleep in the dog's pen of Winterfell.
Better-looking bitches than you're used to, Uncle. My mother's been looking for you. We ride for King's Landing today.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Before you go, you will call on Lord and Lady Stark and offer your sympathies.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What good will my sympathies do them?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: None. But it is expected of you. Your absence has already been noted.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The boy means nothing to me. And I can't stand the wailing of women.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: One word and I'll hit you again.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I'm telling mother!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Go! Tell her. But first you will get to Lord and Lady Stark and you will fall on your knees in front of them and tell them how very sorry you are, that you are at their service, and that all your prayers are with them. Do you understand?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You can't...
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Do you understand?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The Prince will remember that, little lord.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: I hope so. If he forgets, be a good dog and remind him. Time for breakfast...
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion walks from the courtyard to the dining hall where his family is eating breakfast.
Bread. And two of those little fish. And a mug of dark beer to wash it down. And bacon, burnt black.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Little brother.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Beloved siblings.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Is Bran going to die?
Speaker: Myrcella Baratheon

Text: Apparently not.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What do you mean?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: The Maester says the boy may live.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: It's no mercy, letting a child linger in such pain.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Only the gods know for certain. All the rest of us can do is pray. The charms of the north seem entirely lost on you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I still can't believe you're going. It's ridiculous even for you.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Where's your sense of wonder? The greatest structure ever built, the intrepid men of the Night's Watch, the wintry abode of the White Walkers.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tell me you're not thinking of taking the black.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: And go celibate? The whores would go begging from Dorne to Casterly Rock. I just want to stand on top of the Wall and piss off the edge of the world.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The children don't need to hear your filth. Come.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Even if the boy lives, he'll be a cripple, a grotesque. Give me a good clean death any day.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Speaking for the grotesques, I'd have to disagree. Death is so final, whereas life... Life is full of possibilities. I hope the boy does wake. I'd be very interested to hear what he has to say.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My dear brother, there are times you make me wonder whose side you're on.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: My dear brother, you wound me. You know how much I love my family.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: In Bran's room with Catelyn at his bedside, Cersei coming to console.
Please.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I would have dressed, your Grace.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: This is your home. I'm your guest. Handsome one, isn't he? I lost my first boy, a little black-haired beauty. He was a fighter too... Tried to beat the fever that took him. Forgive me. It's the last thing you need to hear right now.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I never knew.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: It was years ago. Robert was crazed, beat his hands bloody on the wall, all the things men do to show you how much they care... The boy looked just like him. Such a little thing... A bird without feathers. They came to take his body away and Robert held me. I screamed and I battled, but he held me. That little bundle. They took him away and I never saw him again. Never have visited the crypt, never. I pray to the Mother every morning and night that she return your child to you.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I am grateful..
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Perhaps this time she'll listen.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Near the Smith in a courtyard of Winterfell.
A sword for the wall?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: I already have one.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Good man. Have you swung it yet?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Of course I have.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: At someone, I mean. It's a strange thing, the first time you cut a man. You realize we're nothing but sacks of meat and blood and some bone to keep it all standing. Let me thank you ahead of time for guarding us all from the perils beyond the Wall... Wildlings and White Walkers and whatnot. We're grateful to have good, strong men like you protecting us.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: We've guarded the Kingdoms for 8 000 years.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Is it "we" already? Have you taken your vows then?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Soon enough.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Give my regards to the Night's Watch. I'm sure it will be thrilling to serve in such an elite force. And if not, It's only for life.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Arya's room, packing things for her trip to King's Landing, having her direwolf assist her. Jon comes in to say goodbye before he leaves for the Night's Watch.
Thank you, Nymeria. Septa Mordane says I have to do it again. "My things weren't properly folded", she says. Who cares how they're folded?! They're going to get all messed up anyway.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It's good you've got help.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Watch. Nymeria, gloves.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Impressive.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Shut up. Nymeria, gloves!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: I have something for you. And it has to be packed very carefully.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: A present?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Close the door. This is no toy. Be careful you don't cut yourself.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: It's so skinny.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: So are you. I had the blacksmith make it for you special. It won't hack a man's head off, but it can poke him full of holes if you're quick enough.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I can be quick.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You'll have to work at it every day. How does it feel? Do you like the balance?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I think so.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: First lesson: Stick them with the pointy end.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I know which end to use.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: I'm going to miss you... Careful... All the best swords have names, you know.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Sansa can keep her sewing needles. I've got a needle of my own.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Jon walks into Bran's room, where Catelyn is still at his bedside.
I came to say goodbye to Bran.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You've said it.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I wish I could be here when you wake up. I'm going north with Uncle Benjen. I'm taking the black. I know we always talked about seeing the Wall together, but you'll be able to come visit me at Castle Black when you're better. I'll know my way around by then. I'll be a sworn brother of the Night's Watch. We can go out walking beyond the Wall, if you're not afraid.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I want you to leave.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Eddard walks into the room, Jon kisses Brandon on the forehead and exits.
17 years ago you rode off with Robert Baratheon. You came back a year later with another woman's son. And now you're leaving again.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I have no choice.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: That's what men always say when honor calls. That's what you tell your families, tell yourselves. You do have a choice. And you've made it. I can't do it, Ned. I really can't.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: You can. You must.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: In the courtyard, Jon prepping his horse to leave for the Wall.
You've said goodbye to Bran? He's not going to die. I know it.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You Starks are hard to kill.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: My mother?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: She was very kind.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Good. Next time I see you, you'll be all in black.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: It was always my color.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Farewell, Snow.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And you, Stark.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: At the split between the Kingsroad and the road that will take Benjen and Jon to the Wall.
There's great honor serving in the Night's Watch. The Starks have manned the Wall for thousands of years. And you are a Stark. You might not have my name, but you have my blood.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Is my mother alive? Does she know about me? Where I am, where I'm going? Does she care?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The next time we see each other, we'll talk about your mother. I promise.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Stopping for rest along the Kingsroad. Robert has a mini table set up full of wine and food.
Gods, this is country! I've half a mind to leave them all behind and keep going.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I've half a mind to go with you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: What do you say, just you and me on the Kingsroad, swords at our sides, a couple of tavern wenches to warm our beds tonight.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You should have asked me 20 years ago.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: There were wars to fight, women to marry... We never had the chance to be young.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I recall a few chances.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: There was that one... Oh, what was her name? That common girl of yours? Becca? With the great big tits you could bury your face in.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Bessie. She was one of yours.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Bessie! Thank the gods for Bessie and her tits. Yours was... Aleena? No. You told me once. Meryl? Your bastard's mother?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Wylla.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: That's it. She must have been a rare wench to make Lord Ned Stark forget his honor. You never told me what she looked like.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Nor will I.
Speaker: Ned Stark
