If you do not," he said, "then we'll have a hunt and somewhere in these woods your horse will stumble and you'll be thrown from your saddle to die. Or so I'll tell your mother. Nothing would please me more." Ser Alliser's going to make me fight again tomorrow, isn't he?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Yes, he is.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I'm not going to get any better, you know?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: WellÉ?? You can't get any worse.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Walking through the gardens of King's Landing.
I hear you're reading a boring book.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Pycelle talks too much.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He never stops. Do you know Ser Hugh of the Vale? Not surprising. Until recently, he was only a squire... Jon Arryn's squire. He was knighted almost immediately after his master's untimely death.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Knighted for what? Why are you telling me this?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I promised Cat that I'd help you.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Where is Ser Hugh? I'll speak to him.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: A singularly bad idea. Do you see that boy there? One of Varys's little birds. The Spider has taken a great interest in your comings and goings. Now look there. That one belongs to the Queen. And do you see that Septa pretending to read her book?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Varys or the Queen?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No. She's one of mine. Is there someone in your service whom you trust completely?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Yes.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The wiser answer was no, my Lord. Get a message to this paragon of yours... Discreetly. Send him to question Ser Hugh. After that, you might want him to visit a certain armorer in the city. He lives in a large house at the top of the street of Steel.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Why?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I have my observers, as I said, and it's possible that they saw Lord Arryn visit this armorer several times in the weeks before his death.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Lord Baelish, perhaps I was wrong to distrust you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Distrusting me was the wisest thing you've done since you climbed off your horse.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Preparing for the Hand of the King's tournament, Ser Hugh is pacing out steps on the joust.
Ser Hugh? Ser Hugh!
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: As you can see, I'm busy.
Speaker: Hugh of the Vale

Text: I'm here on behalf of Lord Ned Stark, the Hand of the king. I'm the captain of his guard.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: I'm sorry. I didn't catch your name, Ser...
Speaker: Hugh of the Vale

Text: No "ser." I'm not a knight.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: I see. Well, it just so happens that I am.
Speaker: Hugh of the Vale

Text: Riding on horseback through King's Landing, Ned and Jory arrive at the armorer.
He said he'd be glad to talk to the Hand himself. He's a knight, you see.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: A knight. They strut around like roosters down here. Even the ones who've never seen an arrow coming their way.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You shouldn't be out here, my Lord. There's no telling who has eyes where.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Let them look.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The former Hand did call on me, my Lord, several times. I regret to say he did not honor me with his patronage.
Speaker: Tobho Mott

Text: What did Lord Arryn want?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He always came to see the boy.
Speaker: Tobho Mott

Text: I'd like to see him as well.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: As you wish, my Lord. Gendry! Here he is. Strong for his age. He works hard. Show the Hand the helmet you made, lad.
Speaker: Tobho Mott

Text: This is fine work.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: It's not for sale.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: Boy, this is the King's Hand! If his lordship wants the helmet...
Speaker: Tobho Mott

Text: I made it for me.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: Forgive him, my Lord.
Speaker: Tobho Mott

Text: There's nothing to forgive. When Lord Arryn came to visit you, what would you talk about?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He just asked me questions is all, my Lord.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: What kind of questions?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: About my work at first, if I was being treated well, if I liked it here. But then he started asking me about my mother.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: Your mother?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Who she was, what she looked like.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: What did you tell him?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: She died when I was little. She had yellow hair. She'd sing to me sometimes.
Speaker: Gendry

Text: Look at me. Get back to work, lad. If the day ever comes when that boy'd rather wield a sword than forge one, you send him to me.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Find anything?
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: King Robert's bastard son.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jaime is standing guard outside of the king's chambers. You can hear King Robert with numerous girls inside his room.
This is for the King from Lord Stark.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Listen. Do you hear them? How many do you think are in there with him? Guess.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Three? Four?
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: He likes to do this when I'm on duty... He makes me listen as he insults my sister.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Forgive me, my Lord...
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Why do I have to forgive you? Have you wronged me?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: We've met before, you know.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Have we? Strange, I've forgotten.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: The siege of Pyke. We fought side by side one afternoon.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: That's where you got your scar?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Aye. One of the Greyjoys nearly took my eye.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Vicious sons of whores.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: They like their bloodshed.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: They stopped liking it at the end. That was a proper battle. D'you remember Thoros of Myr charging through the breach?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: With his burning sword? I'll remember that till the day I die.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: I saw the youngest of the Greyjoy lads at Winterfell. It was like seeing a shark on a mountaintop.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Theon? He's a good lad.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: I doubt it.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: I'll bet you smell of blackberry jam! Let me smell it. Come here.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Can I leave this with you? The message from Lord Stark.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: I don't serve Lord Stark.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: In the mess hall at Castle Black.
Where have you been?
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Watch duty. With Sam.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Prince Porkchop. Where is he?
Speaker: Pyp

Text: He wasn't hungry.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Impossible!
Speaker: Pyp

Text: That's enough. Sam's no different from the rest of us. There was no place for him in the world, so he's come here. We're not going to hurt him in the training yard anymore. Never again, no matter what Thorne says. He's our brother now and we're going to protect him.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You are in love, Lord Snow. You girls can do as you please. But if Thorne puts me up against Lady Piggy, I'm gonna slice me off a side of bacon.
Speaker: Rast

Text: All of the new recruits are sleeping. Jon, Ghost (his direwolf), Pyp and Grenn ambush and gag Rast as he sleeps. Jon threatens him.
No one touches Sam.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Back in the training yard the next morning. Rast is defying Alliser and not attacking Sam.
What are you waiting for? Attack him! You, get in there.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Hit me. Go on, hit me! I yield! Yield yield. I yield.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: You think this is funny, do you? When you're out there beyond the Wall with the sun going down, do you want a man at your back? Or a sniveling boy?
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: After their bath, Viserys drags Doreah by her hair through the camp and into Daenerys' tent.
You send this whore to give me commands? I should have sent you back her head!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Forgive me, Khaleesi. I did as you asked.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Hush now. It's all right. Irri, take her and leave us.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Yes, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Irri

Text: Why did you hit her?!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: How many times do I have to tell you? You do not command me.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: I wasn't commanding you. I just wanted to invite you to supper.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: What's this?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: It's a gift. I had it made for you.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Dothraki rags? Are you going to dress me now?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Please.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: This stinks of manure. All of it.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: You would turn me into one of them, wouldn't you? Next you'll want to braid my hair.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: You've no right to a braid. You've won no victories yet.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You do not talk back to me!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Viserys hit Daenerys, as he mounts her to keep hitting her, she fends him off with a chain.
You are a horselord's slut. And now you've woken the dragon...
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: I am a Khaleesi of the Dothraki! I am the wife of the great Khal and I carry his son inside me. The next time you raise a hand to me will be the last time you have hands.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Inside the Castle Black mess hall, cleaning up.
I know for a fact that some of the officers go to that brothel in Mole's Town.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I wouldn't doubt it.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Don't you think it's a little bit unfair? Making us take our vows while they sneak off for a little sally on the side?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Sally on the side?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: It's silly, isn't it? What, we can't defend the Wall unless we're celibate? It's absurd.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I didn't think you'd be so upset about it.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Why not? Because I'm fat? But I like girls just as much as you do. They might not like me as much. I've never... been with one. You've probably had hundreds.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: As a matter of fact, I'm the same as you.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I find that hard to believe.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I came very close once. I was alone in a room with a naked girl, but...
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You didn't know where to put it?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I know where to put it.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Was she... Old and ugly?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Young and gorgeous. A whore named Ros.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: What color hair?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Red.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I like red hair. And her... Her...
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: You don't want to know.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: That good?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Better.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Oh no. So why exactly did you not make love to Ros with the perfect...
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: What's my name?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon Snow?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: And why is my surname Snow?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Because... You're a bastard from the north.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I never met my mother. My father wouldn't even tell me her name. I don't know if she's living or dead. I don't know if she's a noblewoman or a fisherman's wife... Or a whore. So I sat there in the brothel as Ros took off her clothes. But I couldn't do it. Because all I could think was what if I got her pregnant and she had a child, another bastard named Snow? It's not a good life for a child.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: So... You didn't know where to put it?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Enjoying yourselves? You look cold, boys.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: It is a bit nippy.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: A bit nippy, yeah, by the fire, indoors. It's still summer. Do you boys even remember the last winter? How long has it been now? What, 10 years? I remember. Was it uncomfortable at Winterfell? Were there days when you just couldn't get warm, never mind how many fires your servants built?
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: I build my own fires.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: That's admirable. I spent six months out there, beyond the Wall during the last winter. It was supposed to be a two-week mission. We heard a rumor Mance Rayder was planning to attack Eastwatch. So we went out to look for some of his men... Capture them, gather some knowledge. The Wildlings who fight for Mance Rayder are hard men. Harder than you'll ever be. They know their country better than we do. They knew there was a storm coming in. So they hid in their caves and waited for it to pass. And we got caught in the open. Wind so strong it yanked 100-foot trees straight from the ground, roots and all. If you took your gloves off to find your cock to have a piss, you lost a finger to the frost. And all in darkness. You don't know cold. Neither of you do. The horses died first. We didn't have enough to feed them, to keep them warm. Eating the horses was easy. But later when we started to fall... That wasn't easy. We should have had a couple of boys like you along, shouldn't we? Soft, fat boys like you. We'd have lasted a fortnight on you and still had bones leftover for soup. Soon we'll have new recruits and you lot will be passed along to the Lord Commander for assignment and they will call you men of the Night's Watch, but you'd be fools to believe it. You're boys still. And come the winter you will die... Like flies.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Inside Daenerys' tent, speaking privately to Jorah.
I hit him. I hit the dragon.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Your brother Rhaegar was the last dragon. Viserys is less than the shadow of a snake.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He is still the true King.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The truth now: do you want to see your brother sitting on the Iron Throne?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: No. But the common people are waiting for him. Illyrio said they're sewing dragon banners and praying for his return.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The common people pray for rain, health and a summer that never ends. They don't care what games the high Lords play.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: What do you pray for, Ser Jorah?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Home.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: I pray for home too. My brother will never take back the Seven Kingdoms. He couldn't lead an army even if my husband gave him one. He'll never take us home.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: At the Hand of the King's tournament. Baelish sees Sansa looking at Joffrey who hides his face from her.
Lover's quarrel?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I'm sorry. Do I...?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Sansa dear, this is Lord Baelish. He's known...
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: An old friend of the family. I've known your mother a long long time.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Why do they call you Littlefinger?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Arya!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Don't be rude!
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: No, it's quite all right. When I was a child I was very small and I come from a little spit of land called The Fingers, so you see, it's an exceedingly clever nickname.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I've been sitting here for days! Start the damn joust before I piss myself!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: The competitors step forward on their horses, Baelish introduces them to Sansa.
Gods, who is that?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Ser Gregor Clegane. They call him the Mountain. The Hound's older brother.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: And his opponent?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Ser Hugh of the Vale. He was Jon Arryn's squire. Look how far he's come.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Yes, yes. Enough of the bloody pomp. Have at it!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: The joust begins. The first pass takes its course with no contact. On the second pass, the Mountain's joust strikes Ser Hugh in the neck, causing a massive splinter, and his blood gushing out. This occurs directly in front of where Sansa is sitting.

Not what you were expecting? Has anyone ever told you the story of the Mountain and the Hound? Lovely little tale of brotherly love. The Hound was just a pup, six years old maybe. Gregor a few years older, already a big lad, already getting a bit of a reputation. Some lucky boys just born with a talent for violence. One evening... Gregor found his little brother playing with a toy by the fire... Gregor's toy, a wooden knight. Gregor never said a word, he just grabbed his brother by the scruff of his neck and shoved his face into the burning coals. Held him there while the boy screamed, while his face melted. There aren't very many people who know that story.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I won't tell anyone. I promise.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: No, please don't. If the Hound so much as heard you mention it, I'm afraid all the knights in King's Landing would not be able to save you.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: In Eddard's quarters, Cersei enters.
My Lord, Her Grace the Queen.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You're missing your tournament.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Putting my name on it doesn't make it mine.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I thought we might put what happened on the Kingsroad behind us É?? the ugliness with the wolves. And forcing you to kill the beast was extreme. Though sometimes we go to extremes where our children are concerned. How is Sansa?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: She likes it here.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The only Stark who does. Favors her mother, not much of the north in her.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: What are you doing here?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I might ask the same of you. What is it you hope to accomplish?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: The King called on me to serve him and the realm, and that's what I'll do until he tells me otherwise.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You can't change him. You can't help him. He'll do what he wants, which is all he's ever done. You'll try your best to pick up the pieces.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: If that's my job, then so be it.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You're just a soldier, aren't you? You take your orders and you carry on. I suppose it makes sense. Your older brother was trained to lead and you were trained to follow.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I was also trained to kill my enemies, Your Grace.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: As was I.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: At an inn along the King's Road. Catelyn is heading back towards Winterfell.
Seven blessings to you, goodfolk!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: And to you.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Boy! Bread, meat and beer, quickly.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: Good idea, grandfather. I'm starving. A song while we wait or?
Speaker: Marillion

Text: I'd rather throw myself down a well.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: Grandfather, may be your last chance if you're heading north. The only music the northerners know is the howling of wolves!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Tyrion and Yoren of the Night's Watch enter the inn. Catelyn attempts to hide herself.
I'm sorry, my Lord, we're full up. Every room.
Speaker: Masha Heddle

Text: My men can sleep in the stable. As for myself, I don't require a large room.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Truly, my lord, we have nothing.
Speaker: Masha Heddle

Text: Is there nothing I can do... to remedy this?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You can have my room.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: There's a clever man. You can manage food, I trust? Yoren, dine with me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Aye, my Lord.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: My Lord of Lannister! Might I entertain you while you eat? I can sing of your father's victory at King's Landing!
Speaker: Marillion

Text: Nothing would more likely ruin my supper. Lady Stark! What an unexpected pleasure. I was sorry to have missed you at Winterfell.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Lady Stark.
Speaker: Masha Heddle

Text: I was still Catelyn Tully the last time I stayed here. You, Ser... Is that the black bat of Harrenhal I see embroidered on your coat?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: It is, my Lady.
Speaker: Knight of House Whent

Text: And is Lady Whent a true and honest friend to my father... Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: She is.
Speaker: Knight of House Whent

Text: The red stallion was always a welcome sight at Riverrun. My father counts Jonas Bracken amongst his oldest and most loyal bannermen.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Our lord is honored by his trust.
Speaker: Knight of House Bracken

Text: I envy your father all his fine friends, but I don't quite see the purpose of this.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Knight of House Frey: Lord Walder is well, my Lady. He has asked your father for the honor of his presence on his 90th nameday. He plans to take another wife.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: This man... Came into my house as a guest and there conspired to murder my son, a boy of 10. In the name of King Robert and the good Lords you serve, I call upon you to seize him and help me return him to Winterfell to await the king's justice.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: All of the knights draw their swords towards Tyrion.
King's Landing, Ned Stark arrives at the grounds where the Tourney of the Hand will take place. He enters a tent where Ser Hugh (deceased) is being tended to, he enters to speak with Barristan.
Does Ser Hugh have any family in the capital?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No. I stood vigil for him myself last night. He had no one else.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: He'd never worn this armor before.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Bad luck for him... Going against the Mountain.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Who determines the draw?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: All the knights draw straws, Lord Stark.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Aye... But who holds the straws? You've done good work, Sisters.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ned and Barristan both exit the tent and begin walking.
Life is strange. Not so many years ago we fought as enemies at the Trident.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: I'm glad we never met on the field, Ser Barristan... as is my wife. I don't think the widow's life would suit her.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You're too modest. I've seen you cut down a dozen great knights.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: My father once told me you were the best he'd ever seen. I never knew the man to be wrong about matters of combat.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He was a fine man, your father. What the Mad King did to him was a terrible crime.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: And that lad... He was a squire until a few months ago. How could he afford a new suit of armor?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Perhaps Lord Arryn left him some money? I hear the King wants to joust today.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Yes. That will never happen.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Robert tends to do what he wants.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: If the King got what he wanted all the time, we'd still be fighting a damned rebellion.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ned separates from Barristan and enters King Robert's tent. Lancel, Robert's squire, is attempting to dress him in his armor.
It's made too small, Your Grace. It won't go.
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: Your mother was a dumb whore with a fat arse. Did you know that? Look at this idiot! One ball and no brains. He can't even put a man's armor on him properly.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You're too fat for your armor.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Fat? Fat, is it? Is that how you speak to your King? That was funny, is it?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Both Robert and Ned begin laughing. Lancel also starts to laugh.
Oh, it's funny, is it?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: No, Your Grace.
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: No? You don't like the Hand's joke?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You're torturing the poor boy.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You heard the Hand. The King's too fat for his armor! Go find the breastplate stretcher, now!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Lancel runs out of the tent.
The breastplate stretcher?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: How long before he figures it out?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Maybe you should have one invented.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: All right, all right. But you watch me out there. I still know how to point a lance.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You have no business jousting. Leave that for the young men.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Why? Because I'm king? Piss on that. I want to hit somebody!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: And who's going to hit you back?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Anybody who can. And the last man in his saddle... will be you!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: There's not a man in the Seven Kingdoms would risk hurting you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Are you telling me those cowards would let me win?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Aye.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: É?? Drink.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I'm not thirsty.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Drink. Your King commands it. Gods! Too fat for my armor.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Your squire... A Lannister boy?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Hmm... A bloody idiot... But Cersei insisted. I have Jon Arryn to thank for her. "Cersei Lannister will make a good match", he told me. "You'll need her father on your side." I thought being King meant I could do whatever I wanted. Enough of this! Let's go watch 'em ride. At least I can smell someone else's blood.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Robert?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: What? Oh! An inspiring sight for the people, eh? Come! Bow before your King! Bow, you shits!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Now at the jousting track where there are lots of onlookers, cheering. Ser Gregor bows before the King before he and his horse take off down one lane of the track.
Where's Arya
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: At her dancing lessons. The Knight of the Flowers.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Thank you, Ser Loras.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: After bowing to Sansa, Loras exchanges looks with Renly Baratheon. Loras then rides and bows before the King, also taking off down the opposite track.
Don't let Ser Gregor hurt him.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Hey.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I can't watch.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Behind Ned and Sansa.
100 gold dragons on the Mountain.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I'll take that bet.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Now what will I buy with 100 gold dragons? A dozen barrels of Dornish wine? Or a girl from the pleasure houses of Lys?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Or you could even buy a friend.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: He's going to die.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Ser Loras rides well.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: A trumpet is heard and both competitors race down their lanes. Loras knocks Ser Gregor off of his mount.
Such a shame, Littlefinger. It would have been so nice for you to have a friend.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: And tell me, Lord Renly, when will you be having your friend?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Loras knew his mare was in heat. Quite crafty, really.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Ser Loras would never do that! There's no honor in tricks.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: No honor but quite a bit of gold.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Gregor gets up off of the ground, shouts for his sword. His squire brings it to him and then Gregor severs his horse's head completely off. The crowd is stunned, Gregor then attacks Loras. Knocking him off of his horse and striking him with his sword. Sandor, the Hound, runs down from the stands and fends off his brother.
Stop this madness in the name of your King!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Sandor takes a bow and Gregor storms off. Loras walks up to Sandor, raising his hand in victory.
I owe you my life, Ser.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: I'm no Ser.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Stopping for rest, presumed on the Kingsroad on their way to Winterfell.
Remove his hood.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: On that eve, the captive Imp down-wards from his horse did limp, no more would he preen and primp, in garb of red and gold. (singing)
Speaker: Marillion

Text: This isn't the Kingsroad. You said we were riding for Winterfell.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I did... often and loudly.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Very wise. They'll be out in droves, looking for me in the wrong place. Word's probably gotten to my father by now. He'll be offering a handsome reward. Everyone knows a Lannister always pays his debts. Would you be so good as to untie me?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: And why would I do that?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Why not? Am I going to run? The hill tribes would kill me for my boots. Unless a Shadowcat ate me first.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Shadowcats and hill tribes are the least of your concerns.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Ah... the Eastern Road. We're going to The Vale. You're taking me to your sister's to answer for my imagined crimes. Tell me, Lady Stark. When was the last time you saw your sister?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Five years ago.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: She's changed. She was always a bit touched, but now... you might as well kill me here.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I am not a murderer, Lannister.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Neither am I! I had nothing to do with the attempt on your son's life!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The dagger found
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: What sort of imbecile arms an assassin with his own blade?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Should I gag him?
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: Why? Am I starting to make sense?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My Lady, this way.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: A rock slams into one of Catelyn's men, a hill tribe begins to attack. Rodrik moves Catelyn behind a rock, out of harms way. The men, mainly Bronn begin successfully defending against the tribe. Tyrion sees Catelyn pull out a small dagger, he runs over to her and convinces her to cut him loose.
Untie me. If I die, what's the point?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion, now loose, runs over and picks up a shield. He fends off an attack as another of Lady Stark's men kills him. Another tribesman is nearing Catelyn, Tyrion rushes over with his shield, knocks him to the ground and begins slamming it into his throat, directly in front of, and in defense of Catelyn. The battle comes to an end with many of their men defeated.
Rodrik?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I'll be fine, my Lady. There's no need to bloody yourself.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: Your first? You need a woman. Nothing like a woman after a fight.

Text: Well, I'm willing if she is.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Back at Winterfell, Maester Luwin and Bran are at a small table, Luwin trying to teach Bran. Bran is fixed on watching Theon as he is practicing his archery.
Bran...
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Lords?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: The Greyjoys.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Famed for their skills at archery, navigation and lovemaking.

Text: And failed rebellions.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Good.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: : Mhmm.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Hmm...
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: No. A common saying, but not their official motto.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: We're still on their words.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I don't know them.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: You do know them. Think.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: "Unbowed, unbent, unbroken".
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: That's House Martell.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: "Righteous in wrath".
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: House Hornwood.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: "Family, duty, honor".
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Those are Tully words... Your mother's. Are we playing a game?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: "Family, duty, honor"... Is that the right order?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: You know it is.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Family comes first?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Your mother had to leave Winterfell to protect the family.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: How can she protect the family, if she's not with her family?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Your mother sat by your bed for three weeks while you slept.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: And then she left!
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: When you were born, I was the one who pulled you from your mother. I placed you in her arms. From that moment until the moment she dies, she will love you. Absolutely. Fiercely.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Why did she leave?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: I still can't tell you, but she will be home soon.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Do you know where she is now? Today?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: No, I don't.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Then how can you promise me she'll be home soon?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Sometimes I worry you're too smart for your own good.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I'll never shoot another arrow.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: And where is that written?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: You need legs to work a bow.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Hmm... If the saddle Lord Tyrion designed actually works, you could learn to shoot a bow from horseback.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Really?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Dothraki boys learn when they're four years old. Why shouldn't you?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Now in Theon's quarters inside Winterfell, he's making love to Ros.
Shh... Keep it down. You're not supposed to be inside the castle walls.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: They break.
I thought you were supposed to be an important person around here.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Important enough for the likes of you.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You're not the only nobleman in my life, you know.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Who? the Imp? I'd call him half a nobleman.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Jealous?
Speaker: Ros

Text: Why should I be jealous?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Anyone with a few coppers in his pocket can own you for the night. What's a dwarf like down below? I've always wondered.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Might surprise you.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Hmm?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: He's good with his fingers too. And his tongue.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Generous tipper. I guess gold is cheap for a Lannister.

Text: You are jealous.
Speaker: Ros

Text: I'm a Greyjoy. We've been Lords of the Iron Islands for 300 years. There's not a family in Westeros that can look down on us, not even the Lannisters.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: And what about the Starks?
Speaker: Ros

Text: I've been Lord Stark's ward since I was eight years old.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: A É??wardÉ?ù, that's a nice word for it. Your father rebelled against King Robert and if he does it againÉ??
Speaker: Ros

Text: Theon grabs Ros' neck from behind.
My father fought for the freedom of his people! What did your father do? Fucked a cook and whelped a whore.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You're a very serious boy.
Speaker: Ros

Text: I'm not a boy.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Oh, yes you are. A serious boy, with a serious cock.
Speaker: Ros

Text: I don't want to pay for it.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Then get yourself a wife.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Arya, at King's Landing is running through the halls chasing a cat. She's seen running down a hallway.
Come on. I'm not gonna hurt you.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Ned is in his chambers at his desk, Varys is speaking to him, walking around securing all of the windows before sitting down to talk more seriously.
How is your son, my Lord?
Speaker: Varys

Text: He'll never walk again.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: But his mind is sound?
Speaker: Varys

Text: So they say.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: A blessing then. I suffered an early mutilation myself. Some doors close forever... others open in the most unexpected places. May I?
Speaker: Varys

Text: If the wrong ears heard what I'm about to tell you, off comes my head. And who would mourn poor Varys then? North or South, they sing no songs for spiders. But there are things you must know. You are the King's Hand and the King is a fool... your friend, I know, but a fool... and doomed unless you save him.
Speaker: Varys

Text: I've been in the capital a month. Why have you waited so long to tell me this?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I didn't trust you.
Speaker: Varys

Text: So why do you trust me now?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The Queen is not the only one who has been watching you closely. There are few men of honor in the capital. You are one of them. I would like to believe I am another, strange as that may seem.
Speaker: Varys

Text: What sort of doom does the King face?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The same sort as Jon Arryn. The tears of Lys, they call it. A rare and costly thing, as clear and tasteless as water. It leaves no trace.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Who gave it to him?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Some dear friend, no doubt. But which one? There were many. Lord Arryn was a kind and trusting man. There was one boy... all he was he owed to Jon Arryn.
Speaker: Varys

Text: The squire, Ser Hugh?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Pity what happened to him, just when his life seemed to be going so nicely.
Speaker: Varys

Text: If Ser Hugh poisoned him, who paid Ser Hugh?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Someone who could afford it.
Speaker: Varys

Text: He started asking questions.
Speaker: Varys

Text: We shift to a dark dungeon of King's Landing. Arya is still chasing the cat. She stops to admire a large dragon's skull. She hears two men talking, and hides from them, just in earshot. The two men are Lord Varys and Magister Illyrio Mopatis.
He's found one bastard already. He has the book. The rest will come.
Speaker: Varys

Text: And when he knows the truth, what will he do?
Speaker: Illyrio Mopatis

Text: The gods alone know. The fools tried to kill his son. What's worse, they botched it. The wolf and the lion will be at each other's throats. We will be at war soon, my friend.
Speaker: Varys

Text: What good is war now? We're not ready. If one Hand can die, why not a second?
Speaker: Illyrio Mopatis

Text: This Hand is not the other.
Speaker: Varys

Text: We need time. Khal Drogo will not make his move until his son is born. You know how these savages are.
Speaker: Illyrio Mopatis

Text: "Delay," you say. "Move fast, " I reply. This is no longer a game for two players.
Speaker: Varys

Text: It never was.
Speaker: Illyrio Mopatis

Text: The two men leave, Varys locks a gate behind them. Arya runs to the gate and can't get out. She takes off in the other direction, deeper into the dungeon, to find an exit.
Varys enters the Throne Room, where Baelish is standing, looking at the throne.
The first to arrive and the last to leave. I admire your industry.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You do move quietly.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: We all have our qualities.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You look a bit lonely today. You should pay a visit to my brothel this evening. First boy is on the house.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I think you're mistaking business with pleasure.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Am I? All those birds that whisper in your ear, such pretty little things. Trust me, we accommodate all inclinations.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Oh, I'm sure. Lord Redwyne likes his boys very young, I hear.
Speaker: Varys

Text: I'm a purveyor of beauty and discretion, both equally important.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Though I suppose beauty is a subjective quality, no? Is it true that Ser Marlon of Tumblestone prefers amputees?
Speaker: Varys

Text: All desires are valid to a man with a full purse.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: And I heard the most awful rumor about a certain lord with a taste for fresh cadavers. Must be enormously difficult to accommodate that inclination. The logistics alone... to find beautiful corpses before they rot.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Strictly speaking, such a thing would not be in accordance with the King's laws.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Strictly speaking.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Tell me. Does someone, somewhere, keep your balls in a little box? I've often wondered.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Do you know, I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close. But enough about me. How have you been since we last saw each other?
Speaker: Varys

Text: Since you last saw me or since I last saw you?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Now the last time I saw you, you were talking to the Hand of the King.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Saw me with your own eyes?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Eyes I own.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Council business. We all have so much to discuss with Ned Stark.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Everyone's well aware of your enduring fondness for Lord Stark's wife. If the Lannisters were behind the attempt on the Stark boy's life and it was discovered that you helped the Starks come to that conclusion... To think... A simple word to the Queen...
Speaker: Varys

Text: One shudders at the thought.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Oh.
Speaker: Varys

Text: But you know something? I do believe that I have seen you even more recently than you have seen me.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Have you?
Speaker: Varys

Text: Yes. Earlier today, I distinctly recall seeing you talking to Lord Stark in his chambers.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Was that you under the bed?
Speaker: Varys

Text: And not long after that when I saw you escorting a certain foreign dignitary... Council business? Of course you would have friends from across The Narrow Sea. You're from there yourself, after all. We're friends, aren't we, Lord Varys? I'd like to think we are. So you can imagine my burden, wondering if the King might question my friend's sympathiesÉ?? To stand at a crossroads where turning left means loyalty to a friend, turning right, loyalty to the realm.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Oh, please.
Speaker: Varys

Text: To find myself in a position where a simple word to the King --
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Renly enters from a different doorway and cuts both men off.
What are you two conspiring about? Well, whatever it is, you'd best hurry up. My brother is coming.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: To a small council meeting?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Disturbing news from far away. Haven't you heard?
Speaker: Varys

Text: Arya exits a tunnel outside of King's Landing, at the beach of Blackwater Bay. She heads to the city's gate but is stopped by two guards.
Off with you. No begging.
Speaker: Guard 1

Text: I'm not a beggar. I live here.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: D'you want a smack on your ear to help you with your hearing?
Speaker: Guard 1

Text: I want to see my father.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: I want to fuck the Queen, for all the good it does me.
Speaker: Guard 2

Text: You want your father, boy? He's lying on the floor of some tavern, getting pissed on by his friends.
Speaker: Guard 1

Text: My father is Hand of the King! I'm not a boy. I'm Arya Stark of Winterfell and if you lay a hand on me, my father will have both your heads on spikes! Now are you going to let me by or do I need to smack you on the ear to help with your hearing?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Quick cut to Arya standing in front of Ned at his desk.
You know I had half my guard out searching for you? You promised me this would stop.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: They said they were going to kill you.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Who did?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I didn't see them, but I think one was fat.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Oh, Arya.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I'm not lying! They said you found the bastard and the wolves are fighting the lions and the savage... something about the savage.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Where did you hear this?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: In the dungeons, near the dragon skulls.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: What were you doing in the dungeons?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Chasing a cat.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: A knock at the door, Jory pokes his head in.
Pardon, my Lord. There's a Night's Watchman here begging a word. He says it's urgent.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Your name, friend?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Yoren, if it please. This must be your son. He has the look.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: I'm a girl!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Did Benjen send you?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No one sent me, my Lord. I'm here to find men for The Wall, see if there's any scum in the dungeons that might be fit for service.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Ah, we'll find recruits for you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Thank you, my Lord. But that's not why I disturb you now. Your brother, Benjen... his blood runs black, makes him as much my brother as yours. It's for his sake I rode here so hard I damn near killed my horse! There are others riding too. The whole city will know by tomorrow.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Know what?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Best said in private, my Lord.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Go on. We'll talk more later.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jory, take her safely to her room.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Come along, my Lady. You heard your father.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Jory escorts Arya to her room.
How many guards does my father have?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Here in King's Landing? Fifty.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: You wouldn't let anyone kill him, would you?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: No fear on that count, little Lady.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Ned and Yoren are now alone in Ned's chambers.
Well?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: It's about your wife, my Lord. She's taken the Imp.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: As Catelyn, Tyrion and her men are arriving to the Vale, they're met by a group of guards.
You're far from home, Lady Stark.
Speaker: Vardis Egen

Text: To whom do I speak?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Ser Vardis Egen, Knight of The Vale. Is Lady Arryn expecting your visit?
Speaker: Vardis Egen

Text: There was no time to send word.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: May I ask, my Lady, why he is with you?
Speaker: Vardis Egen

Text: That's why there was no time. He is my prisoner.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: He doesn't look like a prisoner.
Speaker: Vardis Egen

Text: My sister will decide what he looks like.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Yes, my Lady. She will at that.
Speaker: Vardis Egen

Text: The guards all turn their horses and escort Catelyn and her men towards the Eyrie.
The Eyrie. They say it's impregnable.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Give me 10 good men and some climbing spikes... I'll impregnate the bitch.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: I like you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Ned is walking through a courtyard at King's Landing, heading for the King Robert's chambers. He is stopped by a royal steward.
Lord Stark, your presence has been requested in the small council chamber. A meeting has been called.
Speaker: Steward

Text: The King is at the small council meeting, my Lord. He has summoned you.
Speaker: Steward

Text: Is it about my wife?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No, my Lord. I believe it concerns Daenerys Targaryen.
Speaker: Steward

Text: Now at the small council meeting with everyone on the council, as well as King Robert.
The whore is pregnant.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You're speaking of murdering a child.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I warned you this would happen. Back in the North, I warned you, but you didn't care to hear. Well, hear it now. I want 'em dead, mother and child both. And that fool, Viserys as well. Is that plain enough for you? I want them both dead.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You will dishonor yourself forever if you do this.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Honor?! I've got Seven Kingdoms to rule! One King, Seven Kingdoms. Do you think honor keeps them in line? Do you think it's honor that's keeping the peace? It's fear! Fear and blood!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Then we're no better than the Mad King.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Careful, Ned. Careful now.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You want to assassinate a girl... Because the Spider heard a rumor?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No rumor, my Lord. The princess is with child.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Based on whose information?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ser Jorah Mormont. He is serving as adviser to the Targaryens.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Mormont? You bring us the whispers of a traitor half a world away and call it fact?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jorah Mormont's a slaver, not a traitor. Small difference, I know, to an honorable man.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: He broke the law, betrayed his family, fled our land. We commit murder on the word of this man?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: And if he's right? If she has a son? A Targaryen at the head of a Dothraki armyÉ?? What then?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: The Narrow Sea still lies between us. I'll fear the Dothraki the day they teach their horses to run on water.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Do nothing? That's your wise advice? Do nothing til our enemies are on our shores? You're my council? Counsel! Speak sense to this honorable fool.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I understand your misgivings, my Lord. Truly, I do. It is a terrible thing we must consider, a vile thing. Yet, we who presume to rule must sometimes do vile things for the good of the realm. Should the gods grant Daenerys a son, the realm will bleed.
Speaker: Varys

Text: I bear this girl no ill will, but should the Dothraki invade, how many innocents will die? How many towns will burn? Is it not wiser, kinder even, that she should die now so that tens of thousands might live?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: We should have had them both killed years ago.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: She dies.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I will have no part in it.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You're the King's Hand, Lord Stark. You'll do as I command or I'll find me a Hand who will.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Ned removes his badge and places it on the table in front of Robert.
And good luck to him. I thought you were a better man.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Out! Out, damn you! I'm done with you. Go! Run back to Winterfell! I'll have your head on a spike! I'll put it there myself, you fool! You think you're too good for this? Too proud and honorable? This is a war!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Ned is in his chambers quickly packing his things.
I'll go ahead with my daughters. Get them ready. Do it yourself. Don't ask anyone for help.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Right away, my Lord. Lord Baelish is here for you.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: His Grace went on about you at some length after you took your leave. The word "treason" was mentioned.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: What can I do for you?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: When do you return to Winterfell?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Why? What do you care?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: If you're still here come nightfall, I'll take you to see the last person Jon Arryn spoke with before falling ill. If that sort of thing still interests you.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I don't have the time.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: It won't take more than an hour. But as you please.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Baelish exits Ned's chambers, Ned speaks to Jory briefly and then takes off for Baelish.
Round up all the men we have and station them outside the girls' chambers. Who are your best two swords?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Heward and Wyl.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Find them and meet me at the stables.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: At the Eyrie, Catelyn, her men, and Tyrion are all standing in front of Lady Arryn. Her son is sitting on her lap, breastfeeding. He is clearly too old to be doing so.

You bring him here without permission? You pollute my home with his presence? Your aunt has done a bad thing, Robin, a very bad thing. You remember her, don't you? Isn't he beautiful? And strong too. Jon knew it. His last words were, "the seed is strong." He wanted everyone to know what a good, strong boy his son would grow up to be. Look at him, the Lord of all the Vale.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Lysa, you wrote me about the Lannisters, warning me t-
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: To stay away from them! Not to bring one here!
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Mommy? Is that the bad man?
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: It is.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: He's little.
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: He's Tyrion the Imp of House Lannister. He killed your father. He murdered the Hand of the King!
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Oh? Did I kill him too? I've been a very busy man.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You will watch your tongue! These men are Knights of the Vale. Every one of the loved Jon Arryn. Every one of them would die for me.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: If any harm comes to me, my brother, Jaime, will see that they do.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You can't hurt us! No one can hurt us here! Tell him, mommy! Tell him!
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Shh... Shh... Shh, my sweet boy. He's just trying to frighten us. Lannisters are all liars. No one will hurt my baby.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Mommy... I want to see the bad man fly.
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Perhaps you will, my little love.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: This man is my prisoner. I will not have him harmed.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Ser Vardis, my sister's guest is weary. Take him down below so he can rest. Introduce him to Mord.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Mord throws Tyrion into a É??skycell.É?ù
You go sleep, dwarf man. Sleep good, little dwarf. man!
Speaker: Mord

Text: Back at King's Landing, inside Renly Baratheon's chambers. He is sitting, shirtless, with Loras Tyrell kneeling beside him shaving his chest. Loras is also shirtless.
Lord Stark's lucky he still has a head.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Robert will rant for a few days, but he won't do anything. He adores the man.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: You're jealous.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Are you sure this won't hurt?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Only if I slip.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: And you prefer me like this?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Mhmm.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: If you want hairless, maybe you should find a little boy.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I want you.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: My brother thinks that anyone who hasn't been to war isn't a man. He treats me as if I'm a spoiled child. Oh, and you're not? Loras Tyrell, the Knight of the Flowers? How many wars have you fought in? Oh, and how much did your father spend on that armor of yours?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Hold still.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: All I ever hear from Robert and Stannis is how I'm not tough enough, how I squirm at the sight of blood.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: You did vomit when that boy's eye was knocked out in the m?¶l??e.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: His eye was dangling out of the damn socket!
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: He shouldn't have entered the m?¶l??e if he didn't know how to fight.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Easy for you to say. Not everyone is such a gifted swordsman.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I could work at fighting all day, every day, and still never be as good as you.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Yes well, I guess we'll never know.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Finished with Renly's chest, Loras raises his arm so he can shave his armpit.
Everywhere?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Everywhere. So how did it end up? The Targaryen girl will die?
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: It needs to be done, unpleasant as it is. Robert's rather tasteless about it. Every time he talks about killing her, I swear the table rises six inches.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: It's a shame he can't muster the same enthusiasm for his wife.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: He does have a deep, abiding lust for her money. You have to give it to the Lannisters, they may be the most pompous, ponderous cunts the gods ever suffered to walk the world, but they do have outrageous amounts of money.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I have an outrageous amount of money.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Not as much as the Lannisters.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: But a lot more than you.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Robert's threatening to take me hunting with him. Last time we were out there for two weeks, tramping through the trees in the rain, day after day. All so he can stick his spear into something's flesh! Oh. but Robert loves his killing. And he's the King.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Hmm... How did that ever happen?
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Because he loves his killing and he used to be good at it.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Do you know who should be King?
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Be serious.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I am. My father could be your bank. I've never fought in a war before, but I'd fight for you.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: I'm fourth in line.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: And where was Robert in the line of royal succession? Joffrey is a monster. Tommen is eight.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Stannis?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Stannis has the personality of a lobster.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: He's still my older brother.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Loras cuts Renly under his arm.
What are you doing?!
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Look at it.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: You cut me!
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: It's just blood. We've all got it in us. Sometimes a little spills. If you become King, you're going to see a lot of this. You need to get used to it. Go on. Look. People love you. They love to serve you because you're kind to them. They want to be near you.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: You're willing to do what needs to be done, but you don't gloat over it. You don't love killing. Where is it written that power is the sole province of the worst? That thrones are only made for the hated and the feared. You would be a wonderful King.
Speaker: Loras Tyrell

Text: Cersei enters King Robert's chambers.
I'm sorry your marriage to Ned Stark didn't work out. You seemed so good together.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'm glad I could do something to make you happy.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Without a Hand, everything will fall to pieces.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I suppose this is where you tell me to give the job to your brother Jaime.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I don't know. But I do know this, if the Targaryen girl convinces her horse-lord husband to invade and the Dothraki horde crosses The Narrow Sea... We won't be able to stop them.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: The Dothraki don't sail. Every child knows that. They don't have discipline. They don't have armor. They don't have siege weapons.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: It's a neat little trick you do, you move your lips and your father's voice comes out.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Is my father wrong?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Let's say Viserys Targaryen lands with forty thousand Dothraki screamers at his back. We hole up in our castles, a wise move. Only a fool would meet the Dothraki in an open field. They leave us in our castles. They go from town to town, looting and burning, killing every man who can't hide behind a stone wall, stealing all our crops and livestock, enslaving all our women and children. How long do the people of the Seven Kingdoms stand behind their absentee King, their cowardly King hiding behind high walls? When do the people decide that Viserys Targaryen is the rightful monarch after all.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: We still outnumber them.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Five.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Five... one. One army, a real army, united behind one leader with one purpose. Our purpose died with the Mad King. Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse. And everybody wants something different. Your father wants to own the world. Ned Stark wants to run away and bury his head in the snow.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: We haven't had a real fight in nine years. Back-stabbing doesn't prepare you for a fight. And that's all the realm is now, back-stabbing and scheming and arse-licking and money-grubbing. Sometimes I don't know what holds it together.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Our marriage.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: The two begin laughing.
Ah, so here we sit, seventeen years later, holding it all together. Don't you get tired?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Every day.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: How long can hate hold a thing together?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Well, seventeen years is quite a long time.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Yes, it is.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Yes, it tis. What was she like?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: You've never asked about her, not once. Why not?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: At first, just saying her name, even in private felt like I was breathing life back into her. I thought if I didn't talk about her, she'd just fade away for you. When I realized that wasn't going to happen, I refused to ask out of spite. I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask. And eventually it became clear that my spite didn't mean anything to you, as far as I could tell, you actually enjoyed it.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: So why now?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: What harm could Lyanna Stark's ghost do to either of us that we haven't done to each other a hundred times over?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: You want to know the horrible truth? I can't even remember what she looked like. I only know she was the one thing I ever wanted... Someone took her away from me, and Seven Kingdoms couldn't fill the hole she left behind.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I felt something for you once, you know?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I know.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: No. Does that make you feel better or worse?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: It doesn't make me feel anything.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Inside one of Baelish's brothels, Ned is speaking to one of the prostitutes. Jory and Baelish are in the next room.
She looks like him, don't she, my Lord? She has his nose, his black hair.
Speaker: Mhaegen

Text: Aye.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Tell him when you see him, my Lord. If it please you... Tell him how beautiful she is.
Speaker: Mhaegen

Text: I will.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: And tell him I've been with no one else. I swear it, my Lord, by the old gods and new. I don't want no jewels or nothing, just him. The King was always good to me.
Speaker: Mhaegen

Text: When Jon Arryn came to visit you, what did he want?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He wasn't that sort of man, my Lord. He just wanted to know if the child was happy, healthy.
Speaker: Mhaegen

Text: She looks healthy enough to me. The girl shall want for nothing.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ned breaks off from Mhaegen and enters the same room as Baelish and Jory.
Brothels make a much better investment than ship, I've found. Whores rarely sink.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: What do you know of King Robert's bastards?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Well, he has more than you, for a start.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: How many?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Does it matter? If you fuck enough women, some of them will give you presents.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: And Jon Arryn tracked them all down. Why?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He was the King's Hand. Perhaps Robert wanted them looked after. He was overcome with fatherly love.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Come.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jory is staring at one of the whores, who flashes him her breast.
Jory!
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: My Lord.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Ned and Jory leave the brothel with a few of Ned's men. They are suddenly surround by Jaime Lannister and his men.
Such a small pack of wolves.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Stay back, Ser! This is the Hand of the King!
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Was!... the Hand of the King. Now I'm not sure what he is... Lord of somewhere very far away.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: What's the meaning of this, Lannister?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Get back inside where it's safe. I'm looking for my brother. You remember my brother, don't you, Lord Stark? Blond hair, sharp tongue, short man.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: I remember him well.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: It seems he had some trouble on the road. You wouldn't know what happened to him, would you?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: He was taken at my command to answer for his crimes.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jaime draws his sword, causing all of them men on both sides to draw their swords, except for Eddard.
My Lords! I'll bring the City Watch!
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Come, Stark. I'd rather you die sword in hand.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: If you threaten my Lord again...
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Threaten? As in, "I'm going to open your Lord from balls to brains and see what Starks are made ofÉ?ù?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: You kill me, your brother's a dead man.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You're right. Take him alive! Kill his men!
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: A fight erupts, first Jaime's men throw spears straight into the chests of two of Ned's men. Ned draws his sword and moves towards Jaime, fending off several guards in the process. Jory gets to Jaime first. Jaime stabs Jory with a dagger straight through his eye. The fighting ceases and Ned moves forward to Jaime, Jaime's men all stop to watch the fight. The two fend each other off, as they break, one of Jaime's guards stabs Ned in the back of the leg with a spear, causing him to fall to the ground. Jaime is openly frustrated and knocks the guard out. He mounts his horse.
My brother, Lord Stark... We want him back.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Jaime rides off on horseback and his guards follow suit.
Opens at King's Landing, assumed to be Ned's quarters. He opens his eyes to find Cersei and King Robert at his bedside.
Your pardon, your Grace.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Do you know what your wife has done?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: She did nothing I did not command.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Who'd have thought she had it in her?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: By what right dare you lay hands on my blood?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I am the King's Hand -
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You were the King's Hand!
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: You shall now be held accountable.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Oh, will both of you shut your mouths? Catelyn will release Tyrion and you'll make your peace with Jaime.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: He butchered my men.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Lord Stark was returning drunk from a brothel when his men attacked Jaime.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Quiet, woman.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Jaime has fled the city. Give me leave to bring him back to justice.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I took you for a king.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Hold your tongue.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: He's attacked my brother and abducted the other. I should wear the armor and you the gown.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Robert smacks Cersei.
I shall wear this like a badge of honor.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Wear it in silence or I'll honor you again.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Cersei exits the room, slamming the door shut behind her.
See what she does to me? My loving wife. I should not have hit her. That was notÉ?? That was not kingly.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: If we don't actÉ?? there will be a war.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: So tell your wife to return that little shit of an Imp to King's Landing. She's had her fun, now put an end to it. You hear me? Send a raven and put an end to it.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: And what about Jaime Lannister? What about Jaime?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: As you command your Grace. With your leave, I will return to Winterfell and set matters straight.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Piss on that! Send a raven. I want you to stay. I'm the king, I get what I wantÉ?? I never loved my brothers. A sad thing for a man to admit, but it's true. You were the brother I chose. We'll talk when I return from the hunt.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Robert throws the Hand of the King's badge onto the bed where Ned is laying.
The hunt?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Killing things clears my head. You'll have to sit on the throne while I'm away. You'll hate it more than I do.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: The Targaryen girl -
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Seven hells! Don't start with her again! The girl will die and I'll hear no more of it. Put on the badge. And if you ever take it off again, I swear to the Mother I'll pin the damn thing on Jaime Lannister.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Robert exits the room, slamming the door shut behind him. Ned picks up the badge and looks at it.

Back at Vaes Dothrak across the sea, Daenerys is holding one of her prized dragon eggs. She looks up at a pot of coals inside of her tent. She walks over and places the egg into the coals. Irri walks into the tent.
Khaleesi?
Speaker: Irri

Text: Daenerys picks up the egg from the coals.
Oh, Khaleesi!
Speaker: Irri

Text: Irri takes the egg from her hands, dropping it instantly because of the heat. She looks at Daenerys' hands and there are no burn marks. The two compare hands, Irri's have burn marks.
You're hurt.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: A raven caws. Bran is shooting his bow in the courtyard. The raven flies to the crypts of Winterfell, Bran follows. As he enters, again making eye contact with the bird. The raven flies deeper into the crypts. We then see Bran sleeping in his bed, showing that this was another vision, we hear footsteps running towards his door. His door swings opens and Bran sits up in bed breathing heavily. Hodor is carrying the contraption that Tyrion brought the blueprints for. Bran smiles. We then cut to the woods of Winterfell where Bran is shouting as he's riding on the back of a horse.
Not too fast.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Come on, Dancer. (to his horse)
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: When are you gonna tell him?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Not now.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Blood for blood. You need to make the Lannisters to pay for Jory and the others.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You're talking about war.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I'm talking about justice.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Only the Lord of Winterfell can call in the bannermen and raise an army.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: A Lannister put his spear through your father's leg. The Kingslayer rides to Casterly Rock where no one can touch -
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You want me to march on Casterly Rock?!
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You're not a boy anymore. They attacked your father. They've already started the war. It's your duty to represent your House when your father can't.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: And it's not your duty, because it's not your House.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: It goes silent, Bran can no longer be heard jeering at his horse. Robb looks at Theon and stands up looking through the woods.
Where's Bran?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I don't know. It's not my House.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Theon stands up and walks away from Robb, who begins to look around. We cut to Bran riding slowly through the woods. We see someone creeping up behind him as his horse is nickering. As Bran enters a clearing, several Wildlings surround him.
Robb?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: All alone in the deep dark woods.
Speaker: Osha

Text: I'm not alone, my brother is with me.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: I don't see him. Got him hidden under your cloak?
Speaker: Wildling

Text: Oh, that's a pretty pin. Silver.
Speaker: Osha

Text: We'll take the pin. And the horse. Get downÉ?? Be quick about it.
Speaker: Wildling

Text: I can't. The saddle, the straps.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: What's wrong with you? You some kind of cripple?
Speaker: Wildling

Text: I'm Brandon Stark of Winterfell and if you don't let me be, I'll have you all killed!
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Cut his little cock off and stuff it in his mouth.
Speaker: Wildling 2

Text: the boy's worth nothing dead. Benjen Stark's own blood. Think what Mance would give us.
Speaker: Osha

Text: A Wildling is cutting Bran's straps to his saddle, accidentally slicing into Bran's leg but he feels no pain.
Piss on Mance rayder and piss on the North. We're going as far south as south goes. There ain't no white walkers down in Dorne.
Speaker: Wildling

Text: Robb comes into view, behind the four Wildlings.
Drop the knife. Let him go and I'll let you live.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: One of the Wildlings storms at Robb who evades an axe attack. Robb counters, slicing the Wildling's throat. Osha charges Robb who tosses her spins her around by her hair. He fights off and kills the other Wildling. The Wilding in charge has Bran off of his horse with a knife at his throat, meanwhile Robb has Osha (female Wildling) and a knife to her throat.
Robb!
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Shut up! Drop the blade!
Speaker: Wildling

Text: No, don't.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Do it.
Speaker: Wildling

Text: Robb looks at Bran and then back up at the Wildling. He then slowly sets his sword on the ground, still gripping Osha by her hair. He looks back up at the Wildling who suddenly gets an arrow through his chest from his back. As he drops to the ground bleeding, we see Theona few yards behind him with a bow. The Wildling falls dead, Theon approaches. Robb releases Osha from his grasp as Theon walks over drawing his bow on her. Robb moves over to Bran.
Are you all right?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Yes, it doesn't hurt.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Tough little lad. In the Iron Islands, you're not a man until you've killed your first enemy. Well done.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Have you lost your mind? What if you'd missed?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: He would have killed you and cut Bran's throat.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You don't have the right -
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: To what, to save your brother's life? It was the only thing to do, so I did it.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: What about her?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Give me my life, my lord, and I'm yours.
Speaker: Osha

Text: We'll keep her alive.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Osha gives a sigh of release, Theon releases his bow and Robb, holding Bran, assures that he's okay.

Now at the Eyrie, Tyrion is sleeping and rolls to his side at the very edge of his skycell. He awakes, quickly moving back to the wall. He steps over to the door to his cell and begins pounding on it.
Mord! Turnkey! Mord! Mord!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The door swings open and Mord rushes in, batting Tyrion to the opposite side of the cell.
Dwarf man making noise!
Speaker: Mord

Text: How would you like to be rich?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Dwarf man still making noise.
Speaker: Mord

Text: My family is rich. We have gold, lots of gold. I'm prepared to give you lots of gold.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Mord quickly searches Tyrion's pockets for gold.
No gold!
Speaker: Mord

Text: Well, I don't have it here.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: No gold! Fuck off.
Speaker: Mord

Text: Mord hits Tyrion once more with his club then storms out of the cell, shutting the door behind him.

Now in a hall at King's Landing. We see Syrio shutting a door and holding two wooden swords. He slowly steps down towards Arya and tosses her one of the swords, she seamlessly catches it as he takes his fighting stance.
I don't want to practice today.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: No?
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: They killed Jory. My father is hurt. I don't care about stupid wooden swords.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You are troubled.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Yes -
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Good! Trouble is the perfect time for training. When you are dancing in the meadow with your dolls and kittens, this is not when fighting happens.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: I don't like dolls and k -
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You're not here. You're with your trouble. If you're with your trouble when fighting happensÉ??
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Arya makes a move for Syrio, who quickly counters and puts her on her back.

É?? More trouble for you. Just soÉ?? How can you be quick as a snake, or as quiet as a shadow, when you are somewhere else? You are fearing for your father, hmm? That is right. Do you pray to the gods?
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: The old and the new.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Syrio steps back and tosses Arya her sword back, she catches it and assumes the counter position.

Back across the sea in Vaes Dothrak, we're inside a large communal tent. Daenerys is centered around everyone and eating the heart of a horse a the Dothraki and a priest chant around her. Her husband Khal Drogo looks on in anticipation as she continues eating.
She has to eat a whole heart? I hope that wasn't my horse.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: She's doing well.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: She'll never keep it down.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: She keeps eating the heart, nearing the end. The Dothraki onlookers all chant in unison, getting louder and louder. The priestess is also chanting, louder and louder. Khal Drogo stares more intently at his wife, she stares back. The chanting grows louder, as does the priestess.
Tell me what she is saying.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: É??The prince is riding. I have heard the thunder of the hooves. Swift as the wind he rides. His enemies will cower before himÉ?? and their wives will weep tears of blood.É?ù
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The eating and chantines intensifies as Viserys looks on in shock.
She's going to have a boy.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He won't be a real Targaryen. He won't be a true dragon.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: As the chanting is at it's loudest, Daenerys has finished with the heart. Everyone looks on in anticipations, she wretches forward, on the verge of puking. The chanting suddenly halts. Khal Drogo leans in and looks intensly. Daenerys holds everything in and sobs. Her hands bloody, she slowly sits up, keeping everything in as she gulps the final bite. The priestess begins to speak, Jorah translates directly for Viserys.
É??The stallion who mounts the world.É?ù The stallion, is the khal of khals. He shall unite the people into a single khalasar. All the people of the world will be his herd.
Speaker: Jora

Text: Daenerys rises to her feet, speaking in Dothraki to the room.
A prince rides inside me! And he shall be called Rhaego!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The room begins chanting, É??Rhaego! Rhaego!É?ù As the chanting grows louder and louder, Drogo stands up and walks up to Daenerys.
They love her.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: The room's chanting gets even louder. Drogo hugs his wife at her thighs and hoists her up, carrying her around the room.
She truly is a queen today.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah looks to his right towards Viserys, who has now slipped out. We cut to Daenerys' tent. Inside, Viserys opens the container that holds her dragon eggs. He sighs and then puts them into a sack. Jorah walks into the tent behind him, blocking the door.
Don't let them see you carrying a sword in Vaes Dothrak. You know the law.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: It's not my law.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: They don't belong to you.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Whatever is hers is also mine.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Once, perhaps.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: And you have all three.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: I need a large armyÉ?? I'm the last hope of a dynasty, Mormont.
