Text: See how fierce she grows?

I will hear no more.
Mago, find somewhere else to stick your cock.
Mago spits on the ground and draws his sword.
A Khal who takes orders from a foreign whore is no Khal.
Speaker: Mago

Ohosa. Os.

Text: I will not have your body burned. I will not give you that honor.
Mago points out his sword and pushes it to Khal Drogo's chest.
Khal Drogo grins, it doesn't seem to phase him. He continues talking.

When turning his back on Mago, he grabs his daggers and speaks.

Until nothing is left of you but bones!
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo runs towards Mago, while dodging his attacks. While attacking, Mago screams.
First you have to kill me!
Speaker: mago

Text: Khal drogo grabs Mago's sword, disarms him and cuts his throat open. He grabs Mago's throat, crushes it and pulls out his tongue.
He shows Mago's tongue to the crowd, walks back to his chair and throws Mago's tongue on a pile of rotting flesh.
While sitting down, Dany runs towards him.
My sun and stars is wounded.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: A scratch, moon of my life.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: This is the bite of a fly.

I am named Mirri Maz Duur.

A witch.

Text: And spits on the ground.
My mother was Godswife here before me.

All men are of one flock, so my people believe.
The Great Shepherd sent me to Earth to heal his...
Qotho slaps "the witch" and says.
Too many words. A witch's words poison the ears.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: lamb or lion, his wound must be washed and sewn or it will fester.

Khal Drogo lays eyes upon "the witch". While he's seemingly in thought, "the witch" approaches him.
As Dany steps aside, she looks at Khal Drogo's wound.
Entering Winterfell, gathered Stark banner men are having a feast.
We see Greatjon Umber whom is having a conversation with Robb Stark.

I'll not sit here and swallow insults from a boy so green he pisses grass.

Later that night, Robb is having a short visit with Brann Stark. Upon entering his room, Brann is stil asleep.

There must always be a Stark at Winterfell.

You are not to leave the castle walls while we are gone.
Do you understand?
Listen to Maester Luwin. Look after your little brother.
I will.

Speaker: Robb Stark

Robb leaves the room, but as soon as Robb left, Rickon appears.

They've all gone away.

Text: They'll be back soon.

The next morning, Brann is sitting affront of the Weirwood tree.
While saying his prayers, Osha approaches him.

Even slaves are allowed to pray.

Brann is trying to listen and looks up the Weirwood tree. He hears the wind blowing through the leaves.

They see you, boy. They hear you.
Your brother will get no help from them where he's going.
The Old Gods have no power in the South.
The Weirwoods there were all cut down a long time ago.
How can they watch when they have no eyes?
Suddenly Hodor appears.
It appears he was bathing nearby, since he is bare naked holding a towel around his neck.

Hodor.

Are there really giants beyond the Wall?

Text: I tried telling your brother, he's marching the wrong way.All these swords, they should be going North, boy.
North, not south!
The cold winds are rising.
Looking back up to the Weirwood tree, Brann hears the wind again.
At castle Black, the Night's Watch decided to burn the corpse of Othor, whom attacked Jeor Mormant.
Sam decided to share some knowledge.
They were touched by White Walkers.

That's why their eyes turned blue.
Only fire will stop them.

I hope The Wall is high enough.

Catelyn Stark and Ser Rodrik both arrive at Robb Starks camp.
Summer snows, My Lady.

Text: Robb's brought the North with him.

Text: Entering Robbs tent, we see Robb and his banner men discussing tactics.
The River Lords are falling back with Jaime Lannister at their heels.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And Lord Tywin is bringing around a second Lannister army from the South.
Our scouts confirm it's even larger than the Kingslayer's.
One army or two, the Kings in the North threw back hosts ten times this large.

Text: Mother!
Speaker: Robb Stark

Are you bloody deaf? Have no fear, My Lady.
We'll shove our swords up Tywin Lannister's bunghole and then it's on to the Red Keep to free Ned.
You old devil, Rodrik.
Jon.

Text: As soon as the men left, Catelyn hugs Robb.
I remember the day you came into this world red-faced and squalling.

There was no one else.

Text: If you think you can send me back to Winterfell...

No.

Text: you would never be allowed to leave. No.

And if I lose?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Do you know what happened to the Targaryen children, when the Mad King fell?

Text: On the orders of Tywin Lannister. And the years have not made him kinder.

Text: If you lose, your father dies, your sisters die, we die.
Well, that makes it simple then.

Text: I suppose it does.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Arriving at the foot of the Lannister camp, Tyrion, Bronn, Shagga and the hill tribe, decide to stop for a short while.
A conversation follows.
From here it might be best if Bronn and I continue alone.

And feed it to the goats, yes.

Text: All right then. Time to meet my father.
Moving into the Lannister camp, Shagga and the hill tribe follow.
Upon entering the Tywin Lannister's tent, we see Kevan Lannister and Tywin sitting at a table, scheming.
Kevan Lannister  Tyrion.
Uncle. Father.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The rumors of your demise were unfounded.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Sorry to disappoint you.

Text: And who are these Companions of yours?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: This is Shagga Son of Dolf, Chieftain of the Stone Crows.

Text: Timett Son of Timett, ruler of the Burned Men.
This fair maid is Chella daughter of Cheyk, leader of the Black Ears.
And here we have Bronn son of...
You wouldn't know him.

Text: May I present My Lord Father, Tywin son of Tytos of House Lannister.

Text: Lord of Casterly Rock and Warden of the West. Kind of you to go to war for me.
You left us no choice. The honor of the House was at stake.

We have our differences, Jaime and I.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He's braver. I'm better looking.
He's been covering himself in glory.

Text: Jaime smashed the River Lords at the Golden Tooth, and now lays siege to Riverrun, Catelyn Stark's homeland.

Text: And the Starks? Lord Eddard?

Text: Is our hostage.

How did my sweet sister persuade the King to imprison his dear friend Ned?

Text: Robert Baratheon is dead.

Text: Joffrey rules in King's Landing.
My sister rules, you mean.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Stark's son has called his banners.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: He moves south with a strong host.
A green boy.

Text: One taste of battle and he'll run back to Winterfell wi his tail between his legs.
Maybe. Though the boy does have a certain belligerence.

Text: You'd like him.
While we're on the subject of war, I made promises to my friends here and a Lannister always pays his debts.
We shall require 3,000 helms and shields, plus swords, pikes, gorgets, maces...
Suddenly a messenger appears, interrupting Tyrion's request.
If it please My Lord, Ser Addam bids me report that the Northmen have crossed the neck.

And send word to Jaime that I am moving against Robb Stark.
At once, My Lord.

Only if the half man fights with us.

Tywin looks over to Tyrion. Tyrion looks shooked.
Back at Robbs camp, inside his tent we see Robb and his men plotting.

No, we need to get around him and break Jaime Lannister's siege of Riverrun.

To do either we need to cross the river and the only crossing is at The Twins.

Some men takes their oaths more seriously than others.
Meanwhile, outside a few Stark men captured a scout, leading him to Robbs tent.
Robb's right.

Text: We need that bridge.
So what's it gonna be? Do we move against Jaime or Lord Tywin?

Theon covers the map with pawns

Robb walks towards the Lannister scout.
How high did you get?

Text: Rodrik Cassel  You don't have to do this yourself.
Your father would understand.
My father understands mercy, when there is room for it.

Robb.

Ser Barristan Selmy.

A child's faith Such sweet innocence.

Text: At the King's Landing catacombs, Varys goes out to see Ned Stark.
You've seen better days, my lord.

Text: l want you to serve the realm! Tell the queen you will confess your vile treason, tell your son to lay down his sword and proclaim Joffrey as the true heir. Cersei knows you as a man of honor. lf you give her the peace she needs, and promise to carry her secret to your grave, l believe she will allow you to take the black and live out your days on the Wall with your brother and your bastard son.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You think my life is some precious thing to me? That l would trade my honor for a few more years of... of what? You grew up with actors. You learned their craft and you learnt it well. But l grew up with soldiers. l learned how to die a long time ago.

Text: Pity. Such a pity. What of your daughter's life, my lord? ls that a precious thing to you?

Text: Theon shoots a raven coming from The Twins. Robb picks it up and reads the message.

What do you want?

ls there somewhere we can talk?

l'm sure she will give you many sons.

Text: My lord, l É??

Text: Oh, yes, l said some words. And l swore oaths to the crown too, if l remember right. Joffrey's king now, which makes your boy and his corpses-to-be nothing but rebels, it seems to me. lf l had the sense the gods gave a fish, l'd hand you both over to the Lannisters.

And engage!

Text: Good. You'll be ready for this, then. l thought a wolf was more appropriate for you than a bear so l had a new pommel made. lt's called Longclaw. Works as well for a wolf as a bear, l think.

That should get young Joffrey's attention. And it, uh, puts a thousand leagues between you and Thorne. Now go and put your sword somewhere safe and bring me my supper.

lf we do that, they'll never get back across.

Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Robb leaves the meeting right away. Theon laughs while Catelyn watches.
We cut to a shot of Robb's men on the other side of the river, having already crossed the Green Fork of the Trident and heading south.
Back at Castle Black. Jon goes to see Maester Aemon, finding him cutting meat to serve to the ravens.
Sam said you wanted to see me?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l did indeed. Perhaps you would be kind enough to assist me. Tell me, did you ever wonder why the men of the Night's Watch take no wives and father no children?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: No.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: So they will not love. Love is the death of duty. lf the day should ever come when your lord father was forced to choose between honor on the one hand and those he loves on the other, what would he do?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: He would do whatever was right, no matter what.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Then Lord Stark is one man in 10,000. Most of us are not so strong. What is honor compared to a woman's love? And what is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms? Or a brother's smile?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Sam told you.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: We're all human. Oh, we all do our duty when there's no cost to it. Honor comes easy then. Yet sooner or later in every man's life there comes a day when it is not easy. A day when he must choose.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: And this is my day? ls that what you're saying?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Oh, it hurts, boy. Oh, yes. l know.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: You do not know. No one knows. l may be a bastard, but he is my father and Robb is my brother.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The gods were cruel when they saw fit to test my vows. They waited till l was old. What could l do when the ravens brought the news from the South: the ruin of my House, the death of my family? l was helpless, blind, frail. But when l heard they had killed my brother's son and his poor son and the children! Even the little children.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: My father was Maekar, the first of his name. My brother Aegon reigned after him when l had refused the throne. And he was followed by his son Aerys whom they called the Mad King.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: You're Aemon Targaryen.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l'm a maester of the Citadel, bound in service to Castle Black and the Night's Watch. l will not tell you to stay or go. You must make that choice yourself and live with it for the rest of your days. As l have.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Across the Narrow Sea, the Dothraki are on the move. Drogo leads them, but seems to have fainted. Daenerys rides right behind him.
(in Dothraki) My lordÉ?? My sun and starsÉ?? Drogo.

(in Dothraki) My horseÉ??

Text: At the Lannister camp, Tywin is presiding over lunch/war meeting. Tyrion gets there while everyone's already seated and eating.
Our scouts tell us the Stark host has moved south from the Twins with Lord Frey's levies in tow. They're a day's march north.

Bronn managed to keep Shagga from chopping off the dead man's cock, which was fortunate, but even still, Ulf is demanding blood money, which Shagga and Gunthor refuse to pay.

Where did you find one so pretty at this hour?

And l want you to fuck me like it's my last night in this world. Which it may well be.

Text: Back across the Narrow Sea. Drogo is mumbling incoherently in Dothraki (no subtitles provided) inside a tent, Daenerys by his side.
Khaleesi.

Text: (in Dothraki) Stop it! l don't want her hurt.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) No? No? You don't want her hurt? Pray we don't hurt you, too. You let this witch put her hands on our Khal.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Rein in your tongue. She is still your Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: (in Dothraki) Only while the blood of my blood lives. When he dies, she is nothing.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) l have never been nothing. l am the blood of the dragon.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) The dragons are all dead, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: Qotho and the other Dothraki leave.
l think you should wear your armor tonight, ser.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: l think you're right.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah leaves the tent.
You've saved me once more.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: And now you must save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He's beyond the healer's skills. All l can do is ease his path.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Save him and l will free you. l swear it. You must know a way. Some É?? some magic.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: There is a spell. Some would say death is cleaner.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Do it. Save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: There is a price.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: You'll have gold, whatever you want.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: lt's not a matter of gold. This is blood magic. Only death pays for life.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: My death?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: No, not your death, Khaleesi. Bring me his horse.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Daenerys signals to Irri, who leaves to find the horse. We cut to the horse being taken by a rope into to the tent.
Khaleesi, do not do this thing. Let me kill this witch.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Kill her and you kill your khal.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: This is blood magic. lt is forbidden.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: l am your khaleesi. l tell you what is forbidden.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur starts an incantation
Go. Now.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Take her and leave. Take her!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You must go also, lady. Once l begin to sing, no one must enter the tent. The dead will dance here tonight.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Daenerys caresses Drogo's forehand as she moves to leave.
No one will enter.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur slits the horse's throat. Blood spills all over Drogo's chest and Daenerys' face.
Bring him back to me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys leaves the tent as the horse collapses to the ground, dead. Jorah comes to her.
What have you done?
l have to save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: We could have been 10 miles away from here by now, on the way to Asshai. You would have been safe.
(in Dothraki) This must not be.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) This must be.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) Witch.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Nothing good will come of this.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Rakharo tries to talk to Qotho, but gets sucker punched in the face.
(in Dothraki) No, you can't.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Qotho unsheaths his dagger and moves past Daenerys, pushing her towards the ground. Daenerys hits the ground with her belly.
Khaleesi!
Speaker: Irri

Text: (in Dothraki) No further, horselord.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Daenerys starts moaning in pain, while we hear Mirri Maz Duur's incantations in the background. Qotho turns around and lunges towards Jorah. The two fight, but Jorah gains the upper hand and kills him with a sword blow to the face.
Are you hurt?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The baby É??
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Hmm?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: É?? is coming.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Fetch the midwives.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: They will not come. They say she is cursed.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: They'll come or l'll have their heads.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah moves inside the tent with Daenerys in his arms, as screams and incantations from the inside start getting louder and louder in tone.
At the Lannister camp, Tyrion, Bronn and Shae are drinking together inside Tyrion's tent at night, before the battle.
Are you in agony, my lion?
Speaker: Shae

Text: No.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You look like you're in agony. The fire is burning your pretty soft skin.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Ah! Damn you, woman. Are you immune to pain?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Just used to it.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Let's play a new game.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: There's a Braavosi knife game l could teach you.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Does it involve the potential for losing fingers?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Not if you win.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: No! No fire games, no knife games. Let's do something l'm good at.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What are you good at?
Speaker: Shae

Text: l happen to be a great judge of character.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: This sounds like a boring game.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l don't want to play this game.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Fine. Bronn first. Your father beat you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Bronn drinks.
But my mother hit harder.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You killed your first man before you were 12.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: lt was a woman. (Tyrion drinks. Shae looks at Bronn, surprised.) She swung an axe at me.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You've been north of the Wall.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What brought you up there?
Speaker: Shae

Text: Work.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: And you once loved a woman many years ago, but it turned out badly so you've never let yourself love again. Oh, wait, that's me. (Tyrion drinks) Your turn, my mysterious foreign beauty.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l don't want to play.
Speaker: Shae

Text: lt's fun! Look at the fun we're having. Your mother was a whore.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Tyrion drinks.
All right. Your father left the family when you were very young, never to return.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: And we've established the rules about lying?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink!
Speaker: Shae

Text: Tyrion drinks.
You wanted a different life. You came from somewhere and you wanted to be elsewhere.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The whole shit-stained world could drink off that one.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: So, specificsÉ?? You wanted to be elsewhere, but how would you get there? l don't believe the life of the Silent Sisters is for you. So, what's a lowborn girl to do?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Are you sure É??
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink! And don't talk about my mother and father ever, or l will carve your eyes from your head.
Speaker: Shae

Text: My dear lady, if l have offended you, l apologize.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My turn.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Fine, fine. Ask away. Try to penetrate the enigma that is me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Who were you in love with?
Speaker: Shae

Text: That's not how the game works.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l don't care the way the game works.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Our lord here used to be married.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Married?
Speaker: Shae

Text: How did you hear that?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You hear lots of things playing dice with Lannister soldiers.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Another night, perhaps.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Not another night. This night.
Speaker: Shae

Text: lt's not a pleasant story.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Oh, maybe l will cry.
Speaker: Shae

Text: l'm guessing the lady and l can tell more unpleasant stories than your lordship.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: So l was 16. My brother Jaime and l were riding, when we heard a scream. She ran out onto the road, clothes half torn off, with two men on her heels. Jaime scared away the men easily enough, while l wrapped her in my cloak. She was too scared to send off on her own, so while Jaime hunted down the rapers l took her to the nearest inn and fed her. Her name was Tysha. She was a wheelwright's orphan. And she was hungry. Together we finished off three chickens and a flagon of wine. lmpossible as it seems, there was a time when l was unaccustomed to wine. l forgot how afraid l was around girls. how l was always waiting for them to laugh at me or look away embarrassed, or ask me about my tall, handsome brother. l forgot about everything but Tysha. And somehow l found myself in her bed.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: For three chickens, l should hope so.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Well, l imagine that was the end of all that.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l would have killed the man who did that to me.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You should have known she was a whore.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Really? l was 16, drunk and in love.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: A girl who was almost raped doesn't invite another man into her bed two hours later.
Speaker: Shae

Text: As l said, l was young and stupid.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You are still young and stupid.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Shae starts kissing Tyrion, causing Bronn to leave the tent. The next day, the Lannisters ride to battle; Bronn returns to Tyrion's tent to wake him and Shae up.
What is it? What do you want?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're sleeping through the war.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: What?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: They stole a night's march on us. They're a mile north.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Get my squire!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You don't have a squire.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: lf l die, weep for me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You'll be dead. How will you know?
Speaker: Shae

Text: l'll know.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion leaves the tent, fully armoured.
Watch out! Move!
Speaker: Lannister soldier

Text: Out of the way! Move aside!
Speaker: Lannister soldier

Text: Stay low.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Stay low?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: lf you're lucky, no one will notice you.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l was born lucky. Tribesmen of the Vale, gather round! Stone Crows! Black Ears! Burned Men! Moon Brothers! And Painted Dogs! Your dominion over the Vale begins now! Onward, to claim what is yours!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man!
Speaker: Tribesmen of the Vale (chanting)

Text: To battle!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion rides to battle with the rest, but turns around quickly after and is hit with a mace from one of the Tribesmen. He passes out. Later, we cut to the end of the battle É?? dead bodies and swords piling on the ground. Tyrion wakes up to find Bronn talking to him as he's carried on a wheelbarrow.
You're a shit warrior.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l'm alive?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're alive.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Did we win?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We wouldn't be having this conversation if we didn't.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: How did our tribesmen do?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Yeah, good.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: lt's nice to see them getting along.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tywin shows up next to them, fully armoured and on horseback.
You're wounded.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Good of you to notice. l hear we won.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Huh! The scouts were wrong. There were 2,000 Stark bannermen, not 20 [thousand].
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Did we get the Stark boy, at least?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He wasn't here.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Where was he?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: With his other 18,000 men.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: And where are they?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We cut to Catelyn and Rodrik Cassel overlooking the Trident from a safe distance at higher ground.
We should go, my lady.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: No!
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: My lady!
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: Hyah! Hyah!
Speaker: Stark bannermen

Text: The Stark host arrives at the clearing. Robb is amongst them, and he comes carrying a tied and bound Jaime Lannister.
By the time they knew what was happening, it had already happened.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Lady Stark. l'd offer you my sword, but l seem to have lost it.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: lt is not your sword l want. Give me my daughters back. Give me my husband.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l've lost them too, l'm afraid.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Kill him, Robb. Send his head to his father. He cut down ten of our men. You saw him.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: He's more use to us alive than dead.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Take him away and put him in irons.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: lf we do it your way, Kingslayer, you'd win. We're not doing it your way.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Come on, pretty man.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: l sent 2,000 men to their graves today.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: The bards will sing songs of their sacrifice.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Aye. But the dead won't hear them. (making a speech to his bannermen) One victory does not make us conquerors. Did we free my father? Did we rescue my sisters from the queen? Did we free the North from those who want us on our knees? This war is far from over.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: At King's Landing, Arya is chasing down pigeons on the street while staying hidden from the Kingsguard. She catches one and snaps its neck. Soon afterwards, she sees a baker's stall with pastries on display.
Could l have one? A lemon one or any of them.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Three coppers.
Speaker: King's Landing Baker

Text: How about a nice fat pigeon?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Oh, piss off now. Go on.
Speaker: King's Landing Baker

Text: Do you have any stale ones from yesterday? Or any burnt ones?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Piss off!
Speaker: King's Landing Baker

Text: Everyone starts walking up the street, leaving Arya confused. Two street urchins run past her up the stairs.
Hey, where's everyone going? What's happening?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: They're taking him to the Sept of Baelor.
Speaker: Street Urchin

Text: Who?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: The Hand of the King.
Speaker: Street Urchin

Text: Arya follows the crowd to the Sept of Baelor. She climbs up the pedestal of Baelor's statue to get a better view of her surroundings. We cut to Ned Stark being taken from the sept and into the courtyard, in full view of the gathered populace; Baelor's statue is seen on the background to his left. Ned catches Arya's eye at the foot of the statue.
Traitor! Coward!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Ned is taken across the populace and runs into Yoren of the Night's Watch.
Baelor!
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Yoren looks towards the statue knowingly.
Traitor! Traitor!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Ned is taken to a raised platform where Sansa, Cersei, Joffrey, Littlefinger are standing. Sansa smiles warmly at her father as he addresses the crowd.

I am Ned Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Hand of the King. I come before you to confess my treason in the sight of Gods and men. I betrayed the faith of my King and the trust of my friend Robert. I swore to protect and defend his children, but before his blood was cold I plotted to murder his son and seize the Throne for myself. Let the High Septon and Baelor the Blessed bear witness to what I say: Joffrey Baratheon is the one true heir to the Iron Throne, by the grace of all the Gods, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: As we sin, so do we suffer. This man has confessed his crimes in sight of Gods and men. The Gods are just but beloved Baelor taught us they can also be merciful. What is to be done with this traitor, Your Grace?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: My mother wishes me to let Lord Eddard join The Night's Watch. Stripped of all titles and powers, he would serve the realm in permanent exile. And My Lady Sansa has begged mercy for her father. But they have the soft hearts of women. So long as I am your King, treason shall never go unpunished. Ser Ilyn, bring me his head!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: The townsfolk roar with approval; Arya leaves the pedestal and runs towards the commotion. Sansa gets visibly distraught and starts yelling as a member of the Kingsguard holds her back.
No, stop! Please, someone stop him!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: My son, this is madness.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Put him down!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Varys runs to the platform to talk to Cersei and Joffrey, Ilyn Payne puts on his executioner's mask. Arya marches towards the courtyard but is grabbed by the arm by Yoren.
Don't look!
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Let me go.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Shut your mouth. Look at me.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Stop him, stop!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: From Ned's perspective, the roars of the crowd become almost silent; he looks towards Baelor's statue but finds no one there. He lowers his head in recognition of his fate as the sound of Payne's longsword cuts through the hushed silence. We see the sword swing until it reaches his head, with a direct cut to Arya as Yoren prevents her from seeing the actual execution. Arya looks at the sky; a flock of pigeons flies away from the courtyard as she holds her head against Yoren's chest; she sighs heavily, and the screen cuts to black.
